title: Data Analyst (REMOTE)
description:
Everlight Solar is seeking a skilled Data Analyst who will design and maintain functional programs and applications, producing fully functional software applications according to requirements. As a Data Analyst, you play a key role in serving our clients and team members. This will be a full-time, work-from-home "remote" position.


**This is a role for Apple power-users, must know iWork and be skilled with iOS and macOS.**


Everlight Solar is a rapidly growing company and the leader of solar energy in the Midwest. We offer a unique experience that fosters individual growth and rewards performance. Our culture at Everlight is extremely important to us. The work environment is fast-paced and dynamic. We value teamwork, quality, innovation, and customer success. Our ideal candidate is self-motivated, detail-oriented, has excellent problem-solving abilities, is passionate about delivering results on-time, exceeding expectations, and ensuring success for our teams.

  

  

**Responsibilities:**


* Work with large amounts of data to draw meaningful conclusions
* Develop and implement data collection systems and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and data quality
* Provide regular reporting and analysis to team
* Develop and maintain dashboards and reports to track key metrics and performance indicators
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify areas for improvement and to develop solutions to enhance business operations
* Provide training and support to team members on data analysis techniques and tools

  

  

**Requirements:**


* Minimum two years of experience with DOMO
* MajorDOMO Certification Required
* 3+ years experience in data analysis, reporting, business intelligence or financial analysis and a Bachelor's Degree in Business, Statistics, Mathematics, Analytics, Computer Sciences or related field or equivalent experience
* 2 years experience in providing people analytics reporting to organizations
* Demonstrated experience using SQL, and DOMO
* Experience with sensitive and confidential people data in a global environment
* Analyze, evaluate, improve, and document processes and workflows. Identify and take advantage of opportunities for process automation and simplification.
* Proven ability to design and implement new processes and facilitate user adoption.
* Strong understanding of Salesforce.com best practices and functionality
* Strong data management abilities
* A documented history of successfully driving projects to completion
* A demonstrated ability to understand and articulate complex requirements
* Excellent project management skills and a positive attitude
* Must demonstrate exceptional verbal and written communication skills
* Must demonstrate ability to communicate effectively at all levels of the organization
* Must own a Mac computer and be fluent with the Apple ecosystem of software (iOS, macOS, iWork, etc.)

  

  

**Benefits:**

  

* Health Insurance
* Dental Insurance
* Vision Insurance
* Life Insurance
* PTO
* Sick and Safe Time
* Paid Holidays Off

  

  

**Salary: $65,000-$100,000/year**

  

  

*Everlight Solar is proudly an Equal Opportunity Employer. We value diversity of all types and are excited to work with talented individuals from a wide range of backgrounds. Everlight is committed to inclusion and we invite people of any race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality or sex, age groups (18+), and levels of education to apply. Authorized to work in the US and background check required.*

title: ERP Business Analyst Senior
description:
**Position Type :**

Full time**Type Of Hire :**

Experienced (relevant combo of work and education)**Education Desired :**

Bachelor of Business Administration**Travel Percentage :**

5 - 10%**Job Description**

**About FIS**


Are you curious, motivated, and forward-thinking? At FIS you will have the opportunity to work on some of the most challenging and relevant issues in financial services and technology. Our talented people empower us, and we believe in being part of a team that is open, collaborative, entrepreneurial, enthusiastic and above all fun.

**About the team**


Our team comprises a diverse group of talented individuals, each brings unique skills and perspective to the team. Our team includes seasoned employees who bring extensive experience and expertise, yet we are eager to welcome fresh perspectives and innovative ideas.


We have a collaborative environment that drives innovation and fosters continual learning. We share a passion for pushing boundaries and solving complex problems. Together we embrace challenges, celebrate successes, and cultivate a supportive atmosphere where everyone has the opportunity to thrive and contribute their best.


Currently we are an inhouse custom designed application The FIS Pricing Tool (FPT) that leverages several Microsoft products to produce consistent pricing of FIS products. Excitedly we are currently in the process of implementing a new CPQ (Configure, Price, Quote) system to facilitate our organization Future Forward goals.

**What you will be doing**


Your role will be multifaceted and critical to the Development team.

* You’ll be responsible for conducting in-depth analysis, planning, overseeing, and managing multiple large and/or complex projects to create specification documents for development.
* Gathering and documenting requirements from stakeholders, analyze complex data and translate findings into actionable insight.
* You’ll collaborate closely with cross -functional teams implement solutions.
* Your expertise will be instrumental in guiding strategic decision making and drive innovation and foster improvements.
* Testing the functionality of new product releases and present and give details of the project to the stakeholders.

**What you bring**

* Proficiency in a range of computing skills (full suite of Microsoft Office products: Word, Excel (advanced create formulas), Outlook, PowerPoint, SharePoint, Power BI (queries and reports), Publisher Web Conferencing, Oracle CPQ.
* Attention to detail and Problem-solving capabilities.
* Test functionality based on specification documents.
* Ability to readily identify requirements and scope out relevant negative/positive scenarios at every stage of the process as well as identify opportunities needing correction.
* The ability to work within a team and independently with minimal supervision.

**Bonus if you have**

* While not required Oracle CPQ background
* Banking Background
* Six Sigma or Lean
* Strong Leadership or Project Managing abilities.

**What we offer you**

* A multifaceted job with a high degree of responsibility and a broad spectrum of opportunities
* A broad range of professional education and personal development possibilities – FIS is your final career step!
* A competitive salary and benefits
* The chance to work on some of the most challenging, relevant issues in financial services & technology.
* A great workspace with dedicated and motivated colleagues
* A work environment built on collaboration, flexibility, and respect.

  


FIS is committed to providing its employees with an exciting career opportunity and competitive compensation. The pay range for this full-time position is $97,870.00 - $164,410.00 and reflects the minimum and maximum target for new hire salaries for this position based on the posted role, level, and location. Within the range, actual individual starting pay is determined additional factors, including job-related skills, experience, and relevant education or training. Any changes in work location will also impact actual individual starting pay. title: IT Business Unit Lead Analyst
description:
Citibank, N.A. seeks an IT Business Unit Lead Analyst for its Jacksonville, Florida location.


Duties: Perform financial planning, location forecasting, and demand management. Create monthly global headcount multi-year projections including headcount strategy, workforce transformation, functional transfer, structure realignment. Lead the development of centralized processes to reflect global headcount multi-year projections in alignment with current budgets, location strategy forecasts, and workforce transformation objectives. Work with product teams in finalizing their demand considering customer headcount demand, billing methodology, and headcount/dollar planning. Support teams on hiring strategies and serve as contact to coordinate a holistic hiring plan. Review of current approaches, short-term and long-term requirements, identify gaps and develop implementation roadmaps. Focus on an iterative approach to deliver minimum viable products along the way to an end-state solution. Contribute to technical direction and strategic decisions. Influence and negotiate with leadership. Work with cross-functional teams for inputs into the process or as users of the output including Demand Management, Finance, Resource & Location Strategy. Consider the continuous management required for the centralized process including maintaining data quality, improving data accuracy, and adaptability as business needs change. Use Excel, PowerPoint, and Workday reporting. Provide in-depth analysis to define problems and develop innovative solutions. Assess risk in developing solutions to minimize exposure to data entry errors, single points of failure, and escalating, managing and reporting control issues with transparency. A telecommuting/hybrid work schedule may be permitted within a commutable distance from the worksite, in accordance with Citi policies and protocols.


Requirements: Requires a Bachelor’s degree or foreign equivalent in Statistics, Business Administration, Finance, Economics, or related position and 6 years of progressive, post-baccalaureate experience as IT Business Intermediate Analyst, IT Business Unit Analyst, Sr Business Associate, Financial Analyst, Finance Associate, Assistant Manager, Credit Risk Manager or related position involving Technology Planning including Demand Management, Financial Planning and Location Forecasting. 6 years of experience must include: Financial planning, location forecasting, and demand management; Leading workforce transformation initiatives; Working with cross-functional teams; Headcount strategy, workforce transformation, functional transfer, structure realignment; Customer headcount demand, billing methodology, and headcount/dollar planning; Influencing, negotiating, and communicating with leadership and stakeholders; Maintaining data quality and improving data accuracy of central forecasting database; and Excel, PowerPoint, Workday reporting. Applicants submit resumes at https://jobs.citi.com/. Please reference Job ID #24730581. EO Employer.


Wage Range: $146,600 to $149,500

title: BSA/AML Investigations Analyst
description:
**About Paysafe**


Paysafe (“Paysafe”) (NYSE: PSFE) (PSFE.WS) is a leading payments platform with an extensive track record of serving merchants and consumers in the global entertainment sectors. Its core purpose is to enable businesses and consumers to connect and transact seamlessly through industry-leading capabilities in payment processing, digital wallet, and online cash solutions. With over 20 years of online payment experience, an annualized transactional volume of $140 billion in 2023, and approximately 3,200 employees located in 12+ countries, Paysafe connects businesses and consumers across 260 payment types in over 40 currencies around the world. Delivered through an integrated platform, Paysafe solutions are geared toward mobile-initiated transactions, real-time analytics and the convergence between brick-and-mortar and online payments. Further information is available at www.paysafe.com.

  

Are you ready to make an impact? Join our team that is inspired by a unified vision and propelled by passion.

  

To help us fuel accelerated growth, we are looking for an experienced BSA/AML Investigations Analyst. This role is based in our North American HQ in Jacksonville, FL and offers a flexible hybrid work environment where you will have a blend of in office days and remote working days.

 **Position Overview:**


This position maintains a high degree of responsibility and serves a critical role in ensuring Skrill USA, Inc. ongoing compliance. This position is responsible for the review, assessment, and the due diligence of consumers as part of BSA/AML program to aide in the detection of potential money laundering, terrorist financing and fraud using a risk-based approach while applying the company’s BSA/AML and OFAC Compliance Program and related policies and procedures.

 **Your responsibilities would include:**

* Research, analyze and investigate customer account behavior for potential BSA, Anti-Money Laundering (AML), CFT or fraud related suspicious activity. Determine if a SAR should be filed with Financial Crimes Enforcement Network (FinCEN). File SARs within regulatory timeframes and in accordance with BSA/AML Compliance Operations policies and procedures.
* Maintain an understanding of AML regulations; current money laundering schemes; and investigative techniques required to detect such schemes.
* Recognize and escalate high risk suspicious activity to Compliance Management for possible law enforcement and/or regulatory referrals.
* Research and respond to regulatory agencies, including law enforcement agencies, in view of applicable regulatory laws and regulations.
* Achieve and sustain a high level of quality, accuracy, and efficiency in the firm’s response to AML and OFAC matters.
* Provide guidance to business partners in matters of AML Compliance.
* Review rules, alerts and data for case investigation and use in determination of suspicious activity
* Analyze data gathered and make a SAR/No SAR decision – document for required recordkeeping
* Decision and action to request EDD, updated materials, block, or close account
* Accurately and timely prepare and submit SAR filings via BSA E-file
* Update fields in case management system to correspond with the activity being filed on for recordkeeping purposes
* Provide timely AML and OFAC guidance to business partners and training of new associates or escalate to compliance management
* Review new referrals, escalations, or internal suspicious activity reports within internal service levels
* Assist in training opportunities as needed
* Review, research, and complete OFAC escalations from Operations (match/no-match) and complete reporting, blocked account processing and associated processes
* Process additional OFAC processes as required
* Utilize third party service providers and internal systems to perform searches on subjects being investigated as part of CDD/EDD/KYC for customers and merchants
* Review, research, document and respond to external information requests - Exchange of information pursuant to the 314(b) provisions of the USA PATRIOT Act
* Completing dashboards and metrics regarding daily activities
* The analyst will be collaborating with Compliance Management and other SME’s on rules, risk detection scenarios, patterns of suspicious activity identified for purposes of development, implementation and or update to Skrill USA’s systems and/or tools
* Other duties as assigned and may include due diligence processes, other compliance operational processes, testing and quality programs

 **You have:**

* Must have demonstrated experience and be comfortable making critical decisions in a time sensitive and regulatory mandated environment
* Experience working with money laundering/terrorist financing/SAR or equivalent investigations preferred
* Must have demonstrated experience in applying strong problem solving, judgment and analysis to detect and deter money laundering activities
* Ability to work independently, but cohesively within a team of specialized associates, with high integrity and ethics
* Highly self-motivated with excellent communication skills
* Ability to manage and analyze data
* Excellent written and oral formats, including presentations to regulators, auditors, analysts, senior managers
* Exceptional analytical skills, judgment, and attention to detail
* Ability to prioritize tasks and work under pressure
* Must be able to keep abreast of and understand industry rules and regulations
* Adept at analyzing and communicating market information
* Strong knowledge of Microsoft Office applications, such as MS Excel and Word, database management programs and Internet browser-based applications
* Proficiency in third party vendor systems
* CAMS certification preferred
* 4 Year College Degree preferred or 5+ years relevant experience

 **Flexible Working and Location:**


In recognition of supporting employee flexibility, Paysafe has adopted a flexible workplace approach; whereas employees may have the option to work either from their home or in the office. Some employees may have business requirements to be in the office a specific number of days and/or specific days of the week, as determined by line managers; therefore, employees need to live within a commutable distance to their assigned office. This position’s assigned office will be located in our Jacksonville, FL office.

 **Life at Paysafe:**


Our culture values humility, high trust & autonomy, a desire for excellence and meeting commitments, strong team cohesion, a sense of urgency, a desire to learn, pragmatically pushing boundaries, and accomplishing goals that have a direct business impact. We encourage you to apply even if your experience does not exactly align as we value diverse thoughts, experience, and backgrounds.

 **Equal Employment Opportunity**


We provide equal employment opportunities to all employees, and applicants for employment, and prohibits discrimination of any type with regard to ethnicity, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other protected characteristics. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of recruitment and employment. If you need any reasonable adjustments, please let us know. We will be happy to help and look forward to hearing from you.

title: Remote - Corp IT - Business Analyst
description:
Overview:

Fidelity is seeking a Business Analyst as a remote employee working East Coast hours. The Business Analyst will work with business units and software development teams to review, analyze, and evaluate business needs, document requirements, define scope and objectives that support overall business strategies for Enterprise Reporting.  

The Company is unable to sponsor applications for work visas.
Duties:
* Establishes relationships among key stakeholders and acts as a liaison during the design and implementation of system and process changes.
* Works with business partners to elicit, analyze, and document business needs and objectives.
* Prepares and organizes information into functional requirements for consumption by the software development and quality assurance teams.
* Constructs workflows and other diagrams to support the understanding of the functional requirements.
* Create, enforce, and monitor appropriate standards and quality procedures across the established organization.
* Validates requirements with Product Owner, Business Stakeholders and Report Technical Team.
* Establishes themselves as a SME of supported applications.
* Functionally validates critical features.
* Creates presentations and demonstrates features to internal and external audiences.
* Creates and maintains technical user guides to facilitate the learning of applications.
* Understands and communicates the operational impact of any changes to maintain a unified approach of solutions.
* Writes release documentation.
* Supports users, both UI and API.
* Conducts operational and related research to support operations by investigating support tickets and recommending course of action.
* Interfaces with third-party partners to support their usage of published APIs.
* Maintains user confidence and protect operations by keeping information confidential.


Education:

BA/BS in appropriate field of study or equivalent work experience. 5+ years of working experience in business analysis.
Experience:
* Ability to understand business process and translate it into clear functional requirements.
* Excellent understanding of business complexity and project interdependencies.
* Ability to distinguish user requests from the underlying true needs and distinguish solution ideas from requirements.
* Ability to partner with multiple stakeholders.
* Excellent facilitation, collaboration, negotiation, and presentation skills.
* Focused and versatile collaborator who is comfortable under pressure, ambiguity, frequent change, or unpredictability.
* Ability to interpret and or discuss technical information with a non-technical audience.
* Excellent critical thinking skills.
* Ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously.
* Demonstrated ability to learn innovative technology.
* Outstanding written and verbal communication skills.
* Proficient at translating business requirements into detailed use cases.
* Experience in data analytics and the ability to analyze data using tools such as Excel.
* Proficient at using common Microsoft Office Applications (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Vizio, SharePoint, Outlook).
* Experienced with the agile development/Scrum methodology and SDLC (Software Development Life Cycle).
* Professional, positive, and flexible.
* Detailed oriented.
* Analytical and inquisitive.
* Ability to work independently and in a team-oriented, collaborative environment.
* Extremely organized with strong time management skills.
* Excellent communicator.


Additional Information:
* Title Insurance background a plus.
* Knowledge of Microsoft DevOps is a plus.
* Familiarity with Microsoft SQL Server Reporting Services, SQL, Oracle, and database design principles.

title: Black Diamond Link - Associate Data Analyst
description:
SS&C is a global provider of investment and financial services and software for the financial services and healthcare industries. Named to Fortune 1000 list as top U.S. company based on revenue, SS&C is headquartered in Windsor, Connecticut and has 20,000+ employees in over 90 offices in 35 countries. Some 18,000 financial services and healthcare organizations, from the world's largest institutions to local firms, manage and account for their investments using SS&C's products and services.
Job Description
Black Diamond Link Associate Data Analyst
Locations: Jacksonville, FL | Hybrid
Get To Know The Team:
SS&C | Advent’s Black Diamond Link (“BD Link”) product synchronizes portfolio data from local installations of Advent Portfolio Exchange and Axys products with Black Diamond’s wealth management platform. Our clients look to BD Link and Black Diamond to expand the technology platform of their businesses in order to provide new reporting solutions to internal stakeholders and investors. The Associate Data Analyst is a key driver of the successful roll-out of this offering to both new and existing clients, demonstrating the overall value of SS&C Advent’s comprehensive suite of products.
Why You Will Love It Here!* Flexibility: Hybrid Work Model & a Business Casual Dress Code, including jeans
* Your Future: 401k Matching Program, Professional Development Reimbursement
* Work/Life Balance: Flexible Personal/Vacation Time Off, Sick Leave, Paid Holidays
* Your Wellbeing: Medical, Dental, Vision, Employee Assistance Program, Parental Leave
* Diversity & Inclusion: Committed to Welcoming, Celebrating and Thriving on Diversity
* Training: Hands-On, Team-Customized, including SS&C University
* Extra Perks: Discounts on fitness clubs, travel and more!


What You Will Get To Do:
The Associate Data Analyst should be able to interact with staff at all levels in a fast paced environment, sometimes under pressure. Responsibilities of the role include:* Reconcile and analyze incoming daily data files to provide accurate and consistent account information to clients
* Reconcile daily data received from partner data aggregation services to provide holistic wealth information to advisors
* Run daily audits to ensure data remains synchronized with source accounting system
* Learn and operate a proprietary internet-based performance reporting application
* Complete data research items submitted by service teams and clients
* Monitor automatic nightly data jobs for accuracy and completion
* Communicate and coordinate with other internal and external groups to provide industry leading service to clients
* Assist with system and product development enhancements


What You Will Bring:* Bachelor’s Degree from accredited institution in a business-related field preferred
* Finance/Accounting experience preferred
* Knowledge of Microsoft Office, including Excel
* Strong communication and organizational skills
* Problem solving and analytical mindset
* Basic understanding of financial concepts and industry
* Experience researching and troubleshooting difficult issues/complex problems
* Some weekend hours may be required on an occasional basis with hours to be offset during the week


Thank you for your interest in SS&C! To further explore this opportunity, please apply through our careers page on the corporate website at www.ssctech.com/careers.

title: Analyst, Data Management
description:
*The Best Players Need the Best People.*
As an Analyst, Data Management, you will develop strategies that promote effective data governance practices and ensure data is protected, consistent, accessible, and managed across the organization. The Analyst will be responsible for guiding decision-making which will protect sensitive data assets while balancing TOUR needs to optimize data assets to assure that the TOUR has a robust data strategy in today’s digital age. This position will help oversee that the TOUR’s data handling and management are in full compliance with internal policies and external regulations. You will also be responsible for developing and instituting practices for data collection that adhere to all relevant privacy law and evolving those practices as more privacy laws are adopted across TOUR affected areas.
Qualifications* Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience required
* Previous experience in data governance preferred
* Experience and ability to use ETL and Data Integration tools on more than one data platform, preferably AWS cloud technologies
* Demonstrated knowledge/experience with more than one of the following data tools/languages: SQL, Python, Hive, NoSQL, Matillion, Snowflake
* Experience with data privacy laws and regulations as well as working with PII data management
* Experience consulting with internal stakeholders on business priorities and optimizing value through solution identification aligned with business objectives, goals and future data direction
* Experience with maintaining and evaluating Consent Management Platforms (CMPs), specifically OneTrust
* Advanced understanding of emerging trends and new technologies in knowledge management
* Knowledge of existing data cataloguing solutions and experience with their implementation across data assets
* Excellent communication skills and ability to communicate across internal stakeholder groups to create actionable milestones


Responsibilities* Build and maintain detailed audit of TOUR’s core systems and information assets that are held within these systems, as well as the teams and processes that use them
* Implement and maintain data classification standards, ensuring that sensitive data is appropriately categorized and protected
* Create and maintain ownership accountability of corporate data systems
* Maintain and update consent management platforms (such as OneTrust)
* Develop standards, policies and procedures to support the creation and provide technical assurance for the on-going implementation of data governance policies within the TOUR
* Lead and develop policies to ensure data governance policies and practices are embedded throughout the TOUR
* Align data governance strategy program to the broader TOUR technology strategy
* Use knowledge and expertise to identify improvements through reducing data/vendor redundancy and appropriate data reuse
* Must work with different system users and business units to elicit and formally define their data requirements and needs
* Special projects or other duties as assigned.

title: BI Applications Administrator
description:
Location(s)


Alpharetta, Georgia, Birmingham, Alabama, Chicago, Illinois, Downers Grove, Illinois, Jacksonville, Florida, St. Louis, Missouri
**Details**

*Kemper is one of the nation’s leading specialized insurers. Our success is a direct reflection of the talented and diverse people who make a positive difference in the lives of our customers every day. We believe a high-performing culture, valuable opportunities for personal development and professional challenge, and a healthy work-life balance can be highly motivating and productive. Kemper’s products and services are making a real difference to our customers, who have unique and evolving needs. By joining our team, you are helping to provide an experience to our stakeholders that delivers on our promises.*

**Job Description:**

Kemper is seeking a **Senior Power BI and Tableau Administrator** preferably in downtown Chicago, IL or Jacksonville, FL, remote work with travel as needed to office locations.


**Position Responsibilities:**

* Work closely with EDS BI Platforms, Enterprise Architecture, Field Engineering, DevOps, DBA, ETL, user community, and software vendor partners for supporting various initiatives in Power BI and Tableau applications.
* Configure, install, test, and maintain Power BI & Tableau application software for data sources like Snowflake, Postgres Oracle, SQL Server, etc., Maintain Power BI data gateway servers and DB instances/drivers.
* Day to day administration, report development, and maintenance activities for Power BI and Tableau applications– user onboarding and access control (security roles), maintenance of activity logs, usage monitoring, report development/enhancement, deployment, scheduling, platform/report performance tuning, and knowledge transfer/SME for user community and EDS BI platforms team
* Maintain proper back-up/restore operations.
* Provide support & troubleshoot technical issues and ensure system availability.
* Migrations from on-prem to cloud for both Kemper hosted AWS application servers and vendor hosted cloud services.
* Create Runbooks and How-to guides for different installation, configuration & support items.
* Analyze server usage, memory, and workload configuration.
* PL/T SQL coding for report development, data profiling, and performance tuning
* DAX language implementation in Power BI for report development
* Be the liaison and work effectively with Power BI and Tableau vendors.

**Position Qualifications:**

* 8+ years of experience in a combination with Power BI and Tableau administration/report development.
* 5+ years of experience as a Power BI/Tableau application administrator where you have installed and performed software upgrades across different environments.
* 5+ years of hands-on experience developing reports in Power BI and Tableau
* 8+ years PL/T SQL coding experience.
* 4+ years Power Automate experience (PowerShell is a plus)
* Proven working experience in installing, configuring, and troubleshooting Windows based cloud environments preferably in AWS.
* Good understanding of system networking, including firewalls, load balancers, storage, etc.
* Strong experience in providing operational support and problem resolution for large complex application environments.
* Demonstrated problem solving and quantitative skills.
* Should have excellent written and verbal communication skills and able to work with multiple vendors
* Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering or equivalent
* This position is a remote role and can work from a US based home.

*The range for this position is $78,800 to $135,000. When determining candidate offers, we consider experience, skills, education, certifications, and geographic location among other factors. This job is eligible for an annual discretionary bonus and Kemper benefits (Medical, Dental, Vision, PTO, 401k, etc.)*

*Kemper is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran, disability status or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate.*

*We are committed to supporting diversity and equality across our organization and we work diligently to maintain a workplace free from discrimination.*  

*Kemper does not accept unsolicited resumes through or from search firms or staffing agencies. All unsolicited resumes will be considered the property of Kemper and Kemper will not be obligated to pay a placement fee.*

  

*Kemper will never request personal information, such as your social security number or banking information, via text or email. Additionally, Kemper does not use external messaging applications like WireApp or Skype to communicate with candidates. If you receive such a message, delete it.*

#LI-AK1


#LI-Remote

title: Data Governance Analyst/Specialist
description:
**Data Governance Analyst/Specialist**
======================================

**Job ID:** R0262525 **Full/Part-Time:** Full-time
  

**Regular/Temporary:** Regular **Listed:** 2024-02-01
  

**Location:** Jacksonville
  

**Position Overview**
---------------------

**Employer:** **DWS Group**

**Title:** **Data Governance Analyst/Specialist**

**Location:** **Jacksonville**

**Job Code:** **#LI-LV2 #LI-02**

**About DWS:**

Today, markets face a whole new set of pressures – but also a whole lot of opportunity too. Opportunity to innovate differently. Opportunity to invest responsibly. And opportunity to make change.


Join us at DWS, and you can be part of an industry-leading firm with a global presence. You can lead ambitious opportunities and shape the future of investing. You can support our clients, local communities, and the environment.


We’re looking for creative thinkers and innovators to join us as the world continues to transform. As whole markets change, one thing remains clear; our people always work together to capture the opportunities of tomorrow. That’s why we are ‘Investors for a new now’.


As investors on behalf of our clients, it is our role to find investment solutions. Ensuring the best possible foundation for our clients’ financial future. And in return, we’ll give you the support and platform to develop new skills, make an impact and work alongside some of the industry’s greatest thought leaders. This is your chance to achieve your goals and lead an extraordinary career.


This is your chance to invest in your future.


**Team / division overview**

The COO Division is a key enabler for DWS and is integral to the future success of the company by delivering world-class services across a set of key functions. It covers essential Technology and Operations capabilities, including our data programs and digital transformation. The COO aims to deliver a platform which is efficient, scalable, resilient and agile.


Within the COO Division Data Management is responsible for designing and driving the execution of the data strategy at Group and Divisional/functional level as well as coordinating adherence to Data related processes and policies and any applicable local regulations.


**Role Details**

As a Data Governance Analyst you will:


* Identify and collaborate with data owners and stewards across different departments to ensure data quality, accuracy, and consistency
* Support a network of data owners and stewards with appropriate data governance
* Ensure DWS knows what and where the data it uses resides through the agreed DWS Data Governance tools
* Support the evaluation, selection and implementation of data governance tools and technologies to support data governance initiatives
* Regularly assess and refine data governance processes and policies in line with the industry best practice to promote continuous improvement
* Designing effective Data Management policies and processes which support the data strategy whilst enabling risk reduction and compliance with Data related regulatory requirements
* Ensuring DWS’s Data Management frameworks are operational within the business divisions and/or infrastructure functions
* Ensuring adequacy of data sharing, access, retention and disposal for area of accountability, in accordance with defined processes.

We are looking for


* Experience in data governance and data management. ideally in a financial services environment
* Understanding of data governance concepts, principles and best practices e.g., DCAM, DAMA
* Ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams
* Experience of managing data and processes in an enterprise environment with an understanding of database and schema design
* Ability to build and sustain positive relationships with internal and external stakeholders at a strategic level
* Excellent communication, both in listening and conveying messages to a wide range of stakeholder groups
* Strong conceptual and problem-solving skills, with an ability to develop creative and structured solutions

**What we’ll offer you:**

At DWS we’re serious about diversity, equity and creating an inclusive culture where colleagues can be themselves sand it’s important to us that you enjoy coming to work - feeling healthy, happy and rewarded. At DWS, you’ll have access to a range of benefits which you can choose from to create a personalised plan unique to your lifestyle. Whether you’re interested in healthcare, company perks, or are thinking about your retirement plan, there’s something for everyone.


**Some of our core benefits:**

* Competitive Salary and Matched 401K Savings Plan
* Generous Paid Time Away plus Bank Holidays
* Physical and Mental Health Well-Being benefits including (but not limited to) Health & Life Insurance Plans and the support of trained Mental Health First Aiders
* Family friendly benefits including generous parental leave packages (supporting all variations of family set-ups), to healthcare plans and travel insurance
* The opportunity to support our CSR strategy which is focused on combatting climate change & achieving greater social justice. You can make donations to our partnered organisations or take part in corporate volunteering opportunities in your local communities by providing on hand support.

DWS’ Hybrid Working model is designed to find the right balance between in-person collaboration and engagement in the office, which is core to our working culture, and working from home. Each business group varies on the split between time spent in the office and at home, but this will be discussed and made clear as part of your application and interview process. We will continue to review and evolve our working environments and methods to ensure that we are working in the best way possible for our people.


If you require any adjustments or changes to be made to the interview process for any reason including, or related to a disability or long-term health condition, then please contact your recruiter and let them know what assistance you may need. Examples of adjustments include providing a change to the format of the interview, or providing assistance when at the DWS office. This will not affect your application and your recruitment team will discuss options with you.


**Privacy Statement**

The California Consumer Privacy Act outlines how companies can use personal information. Click here to view DWS’ Privacy Notice.


Our values define the working environment we strive to create – diverse, supportive and welcoming of different views. We embrace a culture reflecting a variety of perspectives, insights and backgrounds to drive innovation. We build talented and diverse teams to drive business results and encourage our people to develop to their full potential. Talk to us about flexible work arrangements and other initiatives we offer.
  

We promote good working relationships and encourage high standards of conduct and work performance. We welcome applications from talented people from all cultures, countries, races, genders, sexual orientations, disabilities, beliefs and generations and are committed to providing a working environment free from harassment, discrimination and retaliation.
  

  

Visit Inside Deutsche Bank to discover more about the culture of Deutsche Bank including Diversity, Equity & Inclusion, Leadership, Learning, Future of Work and more besides.  

  

  

  

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer - Veterans/Disabled and other protected categories. Click these links to view the following notices: "EEO is the Law poster" and supplement ; Employee Rights and Responsibilities under the Family and Medical Leave Act ; Employee Polygraph Protection Act and Pay Transparency Nondiscrimination Provision .

title: Board Certified Behavior Analyst
description:
Description:
**Job Expectations:**

* Put the well-being of the client first. Maintain client dignity and confidentiality per HIPAA.
* Abide by all company policies.
* 30-35 billable hours per week (36-40 hour work week) to be comprised of 1:1 ABA therapy and protocol modification for the cases that you work with.
* Oversee client treatment from assessment through treatment delivery.
* Conduct initial and follow-up functional assessments (FBA's, curriculum assessments, and standardized assessments)
* Develop, oversee, and implement client's behavior treatment plans.
* Serve as the clinical lead on client cases
* Provide supervision to Behavior Technicians
* Full case management: monitor and review client programs to analyze data, measure progress, and make necessary changes to the treatment plan.
* Observe program implementation and provide training on interventions as needed.
* Work closely with clients and their families providing family training and support
* Meet with primary caregivers to discuss observations and concerns
* Collaborate with colleagues, parents, and schools to share information and implement best practice intervention programs across settings.
* Promote awareness and disseminate information regarding ASD and Applied Behavior Analysis (ABA) through training.
* Attend and participate in team meetings where ideas, success stories, and recent research topics are presented for discussion and use in treatment.

**Strong Foundations Family provides:**

* Balanced caseloads
* Team meetings with Lead BCBA's for client collaboration
* Reimbursement for CEU's
* Online practice management system and data collection system
* Company issued uniforms, computer and materials
* Generous paid time off and paid holidays
* Salary: Up to $100,000 total compensation package
* Access to HealthiestYou Telehealth doctor
* Medical, dental and vision insurance
* Life insurance, long term and short term disability available
* Supportive administrative back office


Benefit Conditions:

* Full-time or part-time employees eligible


Work Remotely

* No


Job Type: Full-time/Part-time


Pay: Up to $100,000.00 total compensation package per year


Benefits:

* Professional development assistance


Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

* Signing bonus

Lobby closed no extra visitors allowed at this time.


Sanitizing, disinfecting, and cleaning procedures in place


Requirements:
**BCBAs must possess and maintain the following items:**

* Master's Degree in Applied Behavior Analysis or related field
* BCBA Certification in good standing with BACB
* Proof of Completion of the BACB Supervisory Requirements preferred
* 10-year background check (Cleared)
* BLS Certification preferred

title: Data Analyst
description:
LHH is currently assisting one of our top clients with a search for a Data Analyst in the McLean, Virginia area. The successful candidate will have a strong background in data analysis, as well as excellent written and verbal communication skills, and strong acumen to learn the business functions and features that need to be delivered. If you are interested in an exciting opportunity with a highly sought-after organization that offers impactful work, an innovative environment and a diverse and inclusive culture, please apply!

**Responsibilities:**

* 
Analyze data to identify trends, patterns, and insights.

* 
Develop and maintain SQL queries to extract and manipulate data.

* 
Write Python scripts for data cleaning, transformation, and analysis.

* 
Collaborate with stakeholders to understand data requirements and objectives.

* 
Present findings and recommendations to support decision-making processes.

* 
Ensure data quality and integrity through rigorous testing and validation.

* 
Stay current with industry trends and best practices in data analysis.


**Qualifications:**

* 
Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience.

* 
Proficiency in SQL for querying and manipulating relational databases.

* 
Experience with Python programming for data analysis and manipulation.

* 
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.

* 
Excellent communication and presentation abilities.

* 
Ability to work independently and as part of a team.

* 
Attention to detail and a commitment to data accuracy.

title: Dispute Investigation Analyst
description:
---

  


**Position****Title:**

Dispute Investigation Analyst

 **Business Unit:**Operations

**Reports** **To:**

Compliance Manager

 **Location:**U.S.

**FLSA****Class**:

Non-Exempt, Full-time

 **Revision** **Date:** October 2021



---

  


SummaryThe Dispute Investigation Analyst will promptly research and resolve consumer-initiated inquiries and disputes from various channels. Based on the investigation results, will utilize resources to complete meaningful investigations and provide consumers with timely responses 

Essential Functions* Research and resolve consumer-initiated inquiries and disputes from various channels including USPS mail, email, and the Company’s website in accordance with policies, procedures as well as State, local and Federal regulations, i.e. Fair Credit Reporting Act (FCRA)
* Conduct investigations surrounding consumers’ dispute claims. This includes but is not limited to reviewing account notes, collaborating with internal teams, communicating with clients, managing consumer reporting utilizing resource tools, i.e. e-Oscar, requesting Validation of Debt (VOD)
* Research data reporting with Transunion, Experian, and Equifax to ascertain information relevant to the investigation process
* Respond promptly via email to disputes received from internal departments outlining dispute findings
* Compose letter correspondence to be sent to consumers based on investigation findings
* Competently navigate the e-Oscar platform and respond to disputes
* Report system-related issues as well as policies and processes that may be the root cause of disputes
* Complete tracking log for data analysis to be used by internal management
* Provide relevant and timely information to immediate management and peers
* Identify and report on consumer inquiry trends that may impact volumes and SLAs
* Keep up-to-date knowledge, understanding, and compliance with all Federal, State, and local laws and regulations with functional area (including FDCPA laws and State laws) to ensure compliance with all State and Federal regulations and with Company policies and procedures
* Maintain regular attendance and timeliness which are required due to the production-based nature of the business and client requirements
* Provide proactive feedback to management concerning potential problems and recommendations for improvement. Recommend process improvements for efficiencies and best practices
* Adhere to all Company, Client and Consumer confidentiality and security policies and procedures

Non-Essential Functions* Perform other duties as assigned

**Supervisory Responsibilities/Accountabilities**

* This position does not require Supervisory Responsibilities/Accountabilities

Requirements* High School Diploma or General Educational Development (GED) certificate, Associate or Bachelor’s Degree preferred
* Two or more years of applicable analysis or related experience
* Proficient computer skills, including utilization of computerized software programs, MS Office products, spreadsheets and automated systems

* Excellent interpersonal, written and oral communication skills with both internal and external employees, clients and consumers. Ability to listen and communicate (written and verbal). Close attention to detail. Demonstrate ability to work independently, self-starter, energetic, good common sense, ethical and sound judgment.
* Must be able to practically apply Company’s compliance policies, procedures and processes
* Ensure deadlines are met and quality work is produced

**Working Conditions**

Work is generally performed within an indoor office environment utilizing standard office equipment. This position does not normally require travel

**Physical****Requirements**

While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to talk, type, see, and hear while sitting at a computer terminal for extended periods of time. The employee frequently is required to multi-task (*e.g*., talk and type simultaneously). The typing aspect of the job requires the employee to reach with hands and arms; and use hands and fingers to handle/feel the keys. The job requires extensive use of keyboards and computers 

Position Type/Expected Hours of WorkSome flexibility in hours is allowed, but the employee must be available during the department’s scheduled hours and guidelines, which may include at least one or two evening and/or weekend shifts. Full-time employees must maintain continuous full-time employment status. Because of the production-based nature of the job, employees must be able to adhere to their schedule and attendance policies

  


The position description lists the primary functions and requirements of the role and is not all-inclusive. Other responsibilities may be assigned at any time with or without notice. The position description is subject to change to meet the needs of the business. Reasonable accommodations will be provided to disabled individuals when such accommodations would allow the disabled individual to perform the essential functions of the position without causing an undue hardship for the Company.

title: Domo Data Analyst (REMOTE)
description:
Everlight Solar is seeking a skilled Data Analyst who will design and maintain functional programs and applications, producing fully functional software applications according to requirements. As a Data Analyst, you play a key role in serving our clients and team members. This will be a full-time, work-from-home "remote" position.

**This is a role for Apple power-users, must know iWork and be skilled with iOS and macOS.**

Everlight Solar is a rapidly growing company and the leader of solar energy in the Midwest. We offer a unique experience that fosters individual growth and rewards performance. Our culture at Everlight is extremely important to us. The work environment is fast-paced and dynamic. We value teamwork, quality, innovation, and customer success. Our ideal candidate is self-motivated, detail-oriented, has excellent problem-solving abilities, is passionate about delivering results on-time, exceeding expectations, and ensuring success for our teams.

**Responsibilities:**

* Work with large amounts of data to draw meaningful conclusions
* Develop and implement data collection systems and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and data quality
* Provide regular reporting and analysis to team
* Develop and maintain dashboards and reports to track key metrics and performance indicators
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify areas for improvement and to develop solutions to enhance business operations
* Provide training and support to team members on data analysis techniques and tools

**Requirements:**

* Minimum two years of experience with DOMO
* MajorDOMO Certification Required
* 3+ years experience in data analysis, reporting, business intelligence or financial analysis and a Bachelor's Degree in Business, Statistics, Mathematics, Analytics, Computer Sciences or related field or equivalent experience
* 2 years experience in providing people analytics reporting to organizations
* Demonstrated experience using SQL, and DOMO
* Experience with sensitive and confidential people data in a global environment
* Analyze, evaluate, improve, and document processes and workflows. Identify and take advantage of opportunities for process automation and simplification.
* Proven ability to design and implement new processes and facilitate user adoption.
* Strong understanding of Salesforce.com best practices and functionality
* Strong data management abilities
* A documented history of successfully driving projects to completion
* A demonstrated ability to understand and articulate complex requirements
* Excellent project management skills and a positive attitude
* Must demonstrate exceptional verbal and written communication skills
* Must demonstrate ability to communicate effectively at all levels of the organization
* Must own a Mac computer and be fluent with the Apple ecosystem of software (iOS, macOS, iWork, etc.)

**Benefits:**  


* Health Insurance
* Dental Insurance
* Vision Insurance
* Life Insurance
* PTO
* Sick and Safe Time
* Paid Holidays Off

**Salary: $65,000-$100,000/ year**

*Everlight Solar is proudly an Equal Opportunity Employer. We value diversity of all types and are excited to work with talented individuals from a wide range of backgrounds. Everlight is committed to inclusion and we invite people of any race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality or sex, age groups (18+), and levels of education to apply. Authorized to work in the US and background check required.*

title: Institutional Research Analyst
description:
The Institutional Research (IR) Analyst assists in the planning and organizing of the functions of Institutional Research (State and Federal Reporting, Student Analytics, and Workforce Analytics). The IR Analyst assists in the development of internal and external reports, dashboards, and analytic data sets. Uses functional knowledge to work with Information Technology (IT) team members to execute system functionality and programing. Assists with planning, implementation, and management of new features, interfaces, conversions, troubleshooting, end-user training, and process improvement analysis. Maintains expertise in PeopleSoft and other relational database systems used.

At a minimum the selected candidate must have a Bachelor’s degree from a regionally accredited college or university supplemented by five (5) years of related experience in information technology or institutional research. Two (2) years of experience in workforce analytics or comparable data analysis. Two (2) years of experience writing queries, developing reports, and producing visualizations. Additionally the preferred candidate will have a Bachelor’s degree from a regionally accredited college or university in Information Technology, Computer Sciences, or related field supplemented by seven (7) years of related experience in information technology or institutional research. Experience using Oracle Cloud Analytics; experience managing software implantation projects; PL/SQL and T-SQL; and PeopleSoft and other relational database systems. Project Management certification. Familiarity with Florida Department of Education and U.S. Department of Education reporting requirements; analyzing large, complex data sets; and relational database management systems.

For a complete description of this and other positions that we have available and to submit the required online application please visit our website at https://Jobs.FSCJ.edu. Interested candidates must submit a Florida State College at Jacksonville online application; a resume will not be accepted in lieu of submitting a FSCJ online application.

title: Data Analyst
description:

* Provide support for State Strategists (and National Strategists as needed) for all audience counts, general research, and list processing (Mail, Digital, and all other lists)
* Meet All Core Data Fulfillment Needs:

title: Analyst 4 - Database Management
description:
**Position Details:**   
 Our client, a world-leading Pharmaceutical Company in Jacksonville, FL is currently looking for a Veeva Vault Administrator to join their expanding team.  
  
 **Job Title: Veeva Vault Administrator / REMOTE WORK**   
 Duration: 9 months contract, extendable up to 24 months  
 Location: Remote Worker  
 Client Location: Jacksonville, FL  
  
 **Note:**   
 The client has the  **right-to-hire** you as a permanent employee at any time during or after the end of the contract.  
 You may participate in the company group  **medical insurance** plan  
  
 **Job Description:**  
 Veeva PromoMats System Administrator and Data Analyst  
  
 Hours: M-F 9am to 5pm  
  
 We are seeking a skilled System Administrator who specializes in providing support for Veeva PromoMats and has a background in building and maintaining dashboards using Power BI.  
 As a System Administrator, your primary responsibility will be to provide user maintenance and Tier 1 support for Veeva PromoMats, ensuring its smooth operation and optimal functionality for our organization. You will also be responsible for making system configuration and routine changes, documenting vendor releases, all while adhering to change management and SDLC governance.  
 Additionally, you will be responsible for developing new and maintaining existing dashboards using Power BI, enabling data visualization and insights for decision-making purposes.  
 The ideal candidate should have moderate experience with Veeva PromoMats administration, and be proficient in Power BI dashboard development. Good communication skills, problem-solving abilities, and attention to detail are essential for success in this role.  
  
 **What would you consider to be the top 3, non-negotiable skills that you'll be looking for when reviewing candidate resumes?**  
 3 years minimum system administrator experience  
 2 years minimum Veeva Vault system administrator experience  
 Strong SDLC experience for GxP systems  
  
 **Can the role operate fully remote, or will there be onsite requirements for this posting?**  
 On-site preferred, but remote is acceptable based on candidate pool  
  
 **What would you consider to be an ideal candidate background for this position?**  
 The ideal candidate would have a bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or related field, or equivalent work experience.  
 Certifications in system administration and data analytics is considered. Veeva Vault cerfication is highly preferred.  
 Demonstrated experience in system administration, preferably with cloud-based systems. Proficiency in administering Veeva Vault systems is required.  
 Strong knowledge of system configuration, user management, and troubleshooting techniques is essential.  
 Strong experience in SDLC, including creating and updating documentation, is required.  
 Strong skills in data analysis and visualization are preferred.  
 Experience in creating and maintaining dashboards using tools such as Power BI, Tableau, or similar platforms is advantageous.  
 Familiarity with data modeling, SQL, and data transformation techniques would be beneficial.  
 The ideal candidate should have a keen eye for detail to ensure accuracy and consistency. They should be meticulous in their work to identify and rectify any issues or discrepancies that may arise.  
 Strong problem-solving and critical-thinking skills are necessary to troubleshoot system and data-related issues effectively.  
 The candidate should be resourceful in finding solutions and be able to adapt and think on their feet when faced with challenges.  
 Effective communication and collaboration skills are important for working with cross-functional teams, as well as gathering requirements from business users.  
 The ability to present complex information in a clear and understandable manner is necessary when dealing with stakeholders at different levels of technical expertise.  
 A willingness to stay updated with the latest trends, advancements, and best practices in system administration is key.  
 The ideal candidate should have a passion for learning and improving their skills to enhance their performance and contribute to the organization's success. \*\*True end date is 2 years, new PO will be created each year\*\*

title: Data Analyst - Non Exempt
description:
Data Analyst is responsible to improve usability of data in CRM Data Platforms.  
  
 **Project:** The Data Analyst will collaborate with operations data management (ODM) team to understand data challenges along with underlying business needs and analyze them in context of broader use of client data across client along with ongoing future requirements.  
  
 **What will you be responsible for:** " Responsible for eliciting and interpreting the actual needs of stakeholders, not simply their expressed desires. Work with various groups, i.e., Operations, Compliance, Sales and Marketing, etc. and determine data and processing needs.  
 " Leverages extensive knowledge of life cycle data analysis. Advocates data standards within cross-functional teams to ensure data are regarded as accurate, timely, reliable, and trusted by business collaborators  
 " Play a central role in the analysis of the needs of business units, partnering with information technology to deliver on those needs, and may serve as a translator between those groups.  
 " Ensure that data within eco-system is aligned with external data sources using master data management processes.  
 " Acts as a consultant to the business on complex data quality issues. Ensures that data quality monitoring and analyses provided to internal clients and team members are done in a timely manner and are of the highest level of quality.  
 " Implements processes and controls for the creation, consumption, assimilation, and/or destruction of data. Contributes to cross-functional projects. Ensures project goals are in line with data management goals.  
 **What your day to day will look like:** " Support product managers(s) in meetings and presentations (e.g., Meeting notes, presentation materials, business reviews / sign-off)  
 " Collaborate with cross functional teams, with a particular emphasis on partnering with T Rowe Price Technology and Sales Strategy and Enablement Teams to execute on functionality builds to support sales reporting priorities, as well as downstream analytics, client engagement, and Salesforce users  
 " Leads investigations, analyses, and evaluations to determine data quality enhancement feasibility and implications for data accuracy. Makes recommendations to more senior professionals based on findings.  
 **What would we need to see from you:** " Data Management experience supporting asset management data domains such as client services, distribution, and marketing is preferred  
 " Experience working on complex data ecosystem. Experience in data governance, data quality, master data management tools required  
 " Salesforce Certifications and SQL Knowledge is plus but not required.  
 " Exposure working with Informatica Master Data Management is plus but not required.  
 " Bachelor's degree from an accredited college or university is preferred  
 **Top Skills:** Data Governance and Data Quality (20%), Data Integration (ETL) (20%), Data Analysis (20%), Salesforce (20%), Asset Management Distribution Industry (20%)  
 **Skills and Abilities:** " Thoughtful process of analyzing data and problem-solving skills to reach a well-reasoned solution.  
 " High sense of urgency and follow through. Partnering effectively to execute on common goals.  
 " Superb communication skills to explain big story around various data scenarios and drive common understanding of problem in hand along with the proposed solution.  
 " Strong interpersonal skills: ability to build the trust and confidence of colleagues, strengthen relationships through ongoing dialog and interactions, and collaborate well with others internally and externally.  
 " Ability to draw own conclusions, articulate positions, communicate key messages, make recommendations, and influence in a team  
 RATE RANGE: 40-45/HR (based on experience)

title: College Coop: Data Insights and Reporting Specialist (Perez)
description:
The Risk Adjustment Analytics Department is responsible for providing actionable insights and reporting to support our operational and clinical team's efforts around risk accuracy for both Medicare Advantage, and the Individual and Small Group markets.

  


**Student Job Description**:



This student role will contribute to the development of data analysis for a variety of analytic solutions focused on Risk Accuracy supporting the Government Markets (Medicare Advantage, Individual and Small Group) segments.

  



Contributing activities include, but are not limited to:


* Maintaining process documents.


* Developing code books as part of an analysis plan and contributing to summary decks.


* A key component of this student role is conducting a final presentation on a member cohort of choice (e.g., low-income seniors 75+, pregnant women receiving subsidy/cost share reduction, under 65 disabled population, etc.). Through a lens of risk accuracy, the presentation will cover:



o Descriptive statistics.

o Disease prevalence.

o Utilization statistics.

o Quality statistics.
**Required Skills**:


* Strong analytical thinking skills.


* Intermediate excel knowledge.


* Basic SQL skills are an advantage, not a requirement.

  


**Preferred Majors**:


Economics, Finance, Health Administration, Actuarial Science, Public Policy, Business, Math, Statistics

  


**Classification**: Senior, Recent Grad.


**Minimum GPA**: 3.0+

title: Healthcare Business Analyst
description:
Seeking a Healthcare Analyst to join our team. We are a small company located in Paoli, PA. We have people working at the office and working remotely in multiple states. Our clients we work with are primarily Medicare and Medicaid plans and TPA's. We help our clients manage their member and provider communications. We have a platform our clients use to track the communications i.e. letters, statements, EOB's, EOP's, ID cards, Welcome kits to name some of what we handle for our clients.  

  

 Job Description:-  

  

* Good understanding of Medicare, Medicaid and other government healthcare programs. Experience with Eligibility, Enrollment preferred. Minimum 1-2 years of experience.
* Ability to analyze issues / errors reported by customer and perform first level of analysis before handing over to technical teams.
* Act as the single point of contact for clients, manage stake holders and customer expectations, and facilitate resolution of issues.
* Basic understanding of Databases, with hands on experience in writing queries and analyze data files, if required to aid analysis and support activities (mandatory)
* Proactively manage Client needs by understanding business requirements, criticality of issues, ensuring timely updates and maintain customer satisfaction.
* Proficiency with MS Excel and other MS Office tools.
* Hands on experience in creating functional and technical documentation.


  

 This BA will be less involved in SDLC activities (which a typical IT Project BAs does in other software projects) and more in working extensively with clients - managing customer expectations, conflict resolution, build rapport with end users and work with them through tickets proactively, provide a first level trouble shooting and ensure customer satisfaction.  

  

Compensation – depends on experience. If possible, I would like to find a Jr analyst with some experience.  

 $60k to start, but some room for negotiation.  

We don’t currently have health insurance, but we offer some additional compensation to help offset the cost of health coverage, vacation and 401k plan.

title: Senior Data Visualization/Data Analyst Specialist
description:
LifeLens Technologies, Inc. is a medical device developer located in beautiful Bucks County, PA. We are pioneering innovative, next-generation treatment devices for personal health monitoring.

  

We are seeking to hire a Senior Data Visualization Specialist. Inthis role, you will collaborate with a team to design efficient reports for our cutting-edge technologies designed to revolutionize wearable health care. You are detail-oriented and goal-driven. You are a capable problem solver with excellent organizational skills and superior verbal and written communication skills. Your passion and drive will be rewarded with a competitive salary, benefits, and long-term growth opportunities.

 **This is a full-time, on-site position.** Occasional work-from-home is available to the right candidate.

 **Responsibilities:**


* Produce insights from a dataset using narratives and visualizations.
* Delivers rapid prototypes and proof-of-concept reporting capabilities.
* Communicate meaningful insights from large data sets.
* Design, develop, and maintain sophisticated interactive dashboards and reports.
* Present data in an intuitive easy to understand format.
* Fostering a team environment in which designers feel engaged and motivated.
* Mentor junior staff and lead team initiatives.
* Collaborating with PM, and Dev to deliver high-quality products.

  


**Qualifications:**


* Experience working with Big Data solutions.
* Knowledge of analytical approaches, methods, and modeling
* Fluency using statistics and visualizations to answer questions about data sets.
* Experience working with multivariate and/or “large” datasets using conventional statistical techniques.
* Knowledge of programming languages like Python, R or SQL
* Experience with reporting and creating metrics.
* Understand data mining and predictive modeling techniques.

  


**Required:**


* Proven track record of career success in Healthcare Data Visualization
* Healthcare Data experience
* Bachelor's degree in Data Science or equivalent technical discipline

  


**Preferred:**


* 10 + years of related work experience
* MS in Data Science or equivalent technical discipline

  


**Benefits:**


* Health Insurance
* Dental & Vision Insurance
* Paid Time Off
* Flextime
* Stock Option Incentive

**Title:** Data Analyst - Transportation


**Reports To:** Administrative Supervisor



For forward-thinking administrators and educators, opportunities abound in the School District of Philadelphia. The School District of Philadelphia is committed to transforming the education opportunities it offers the city’s more than 203,000 school-aged children. The District seeks leaders who have a passion for working with schools, principals and communities who are committed to ensuring all students achieve. Serving a population as diverse as ours requires creativity, commitment and vision. Will you join us?


**Job Summary:**



Provides administrative and analytic support to internal and external constituents. Designs, modifies, develops, maintains and implements data software and tracking systems. Creates reports/dashboards, develops automated metrics dashboards of key business metrics at requested frequencies and provides ad-hoc data analysis. Trouble shoots, maintains databases and serves as a resource to District personnel and representatives of external organizations.


**Essential Functions:**


**All Specialties**


* Fulfills data requests from upper District management, media sources, outside benchmarking organizations, government agencies, and other internal and external customers; refines requests for information to provide management with improved decision-making capabilities.


* Designs, implements, maintains, validates and analyzes data maintained in databases to ensure accuracy; identifies areas where data quality requires improvement and collaborates with team members to resolve issues.


* Prepares analytical data reports for multifunctional purposes on a regular and ad hoc basis; identifies maps and integrates new data sources.


* Troubleshoots and provides end-user support for databases in the assigned division.


* Creates reports utilizing the District’s data warehouse.


* Serves as a resource for development projects.


* Provides data and technical support to various administrative offices and schools to enable them to make data driven decisions.


* Furnishes data to external constituents to inform and foster positive relationships.


* Develops reporting tools that capture pertinent academic and climate indicators such as school-wide and student-level performance data.


* Develops clear, simple, visual displays of data that inform high-stake decisions.


**Transportation Specialty Specific:**


* Compiles data for tracking vendor contract compliance.


* Creates and manages data for vendor performance dashboards and processes for tracking non-compliance penalties


* Maintains accurate records of vendor, vehicle and route assignments and special education routes for financial reporting.


* Assists with the preparation of all reports needed for state reimbursements.


* Maintains accurate directory of all vendor contacts and collect and disseminate information as needed.


* Optimizes and implements processes and manage daily collection of daily, weekly or monthly data required from vendors (i.e. ridership logs, on-time performance, bus attendant assignments), and synthesize data obtained to generate reports for management.

  

**Qualifications** **Minimum Requirements:**


* Bachelor’s degree from an accredited college or university.


* Three years of full-time, paid, professional experience with database technology, educational data reporting and analysis and/or educational performance data.



OR


* **Any equivalent combination of training and experience determined to be acceptable by the Office of Talent in collaboration with the assigned office.**

  

**Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:**


**Demonstrated knowledge of:**



o various databases such as Filemaker Pro, MS Excel and MS Access. o reporting applications such as Crystal Reports and District mainframe Disystems. o Google docs.



o applied statistics and using information to change behaviors and outcomes. o administrative policies and practices.  



  

**Demonstrated ability to****:**



o create and generate reports through Crystal Reports or other District reporting tools, analyzing data from the District’s mainframe system.



o manipulate data using various spreadsheet applications such as MS Excel. o prepare statistical reports using statistical software such as STTA, SPSS. o meet multiple deadlines in a fast paced and demanding work environment. o work independently in a fluid environment as part of a team to accomplish goals. o think analytically and logically.



o support administrators in the attainment of District goals and objectives. o operate a personal computer.



o express ideas effectively, both orally and in writing.



o establish and maintain effective working relationships with both internal staff and external partners.



o give attention to detail.



o apply problem solving skills in the maintenance of databases/ tracking systems. o be passionate about educational equity.



o be passionate about using quantitative analysis to drive policy.

title: Business Analyst (Hybrid)
description:
***\*\*\* This is a HYBRID position\*\*\**** 

**Job Summary:**

The ERP Business Analyst (BA) supports our client's ERP systems project. The BA works with our client’s functional and technical stakeholders to gather business requirements and document processes for ERP system testing and QA. The BA will coordinate project stakeholders to effectively implement large-scale organizational, process and system improvements. The BA will report up to project stakeholders using project management tools and desired client reporting structures. The position is located onsite and remote in Philadelphia with a hybrid work option available.

**Essential Functions / Responsibilities:**

* Support in the design, configuration, and implementation efforts or the system modules.
* Performs analysis on the District’s enrollment that supports planning, budgeting, staffing, school admissions, and attendance verification.
* Develop Testing Plans, strategies, and test cases
* Document and communicate test results
* Identify and facilitate issue resolution with functional and technical groups
* Conduct business analysis activities by working with functional and technical stakeholders to support the functional systems, data integrations, data validation, data cleansing, testing.
* Organize and facilitate stakeholder requirement sessions
* Demonstrate the ability to document, define, analyze and translate functional and technical business requirements
* Translate business needs into requirements specifications and clearly communicate requirements to both the business and technical stakeholders
* Lead in the development and review of requirements documents, use cases, test cases and other functional and technical artifacts
* Promote best practices in data analysis and reporting
* Capture and document meeting minutes, requirements, work-flows and best practices
* Effectively communicate to management and client stakeholders on work products and status
* Participate in enterprise-level project teams to identify and implement process and system improvements.
* Responsible to understand Worldgate’s values and behaviors (The Worldgate Way)
* Ensure that my daily interactions with Worldgate internal and external parties align to Worldgate’s values and behaviors.

**Key Competencies:**

* Business Analysis
* Problem Solving
* Technical Capacity
* Team Collaboration

**Education, Experience and Certifications:**

* Bachelor's degree (B. A. or B.S.) from four-year college or university
* 3+ years of experience as a business analyst
* Experience leading and presenting meetings to steakholders

**Specific Knowledge, Skills & Abilities:**

* Data Analysis
* Experience with data analysis using Microsoft Excel and SQL Database
* Experience with implementing large-scale organizational, process and system improvements
* Business Intelligence reporting tools.
* Organizational skills, communication skills and strong attention to detail
* Knowledge of BI reporting tools
* Knowledge of back-end database systems and database languages

Worldgate LLC provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment, without regard to race, color, age, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, ancestry, national origin, disability, pregnancy, marital status, or gender identity.
