title: Business Analyst (Hybrid)
description:
**ABOUT COASTAL**

At Coastal Payroll Services, we're more than payroll. Coastal is a leading provider of human capital management services headquartered in Southern California that supports thousands of clients in California and nationwide. Driven by human connection, we believe in putting people first and have grown a team that genuinely cares about our clients. We promote a workplace that is fast-paced, fun, and creative. Coastal has proudly earned recognition from leading publications for several consecutive years, including the San Diego Business Journal, Inc. 5000, and Fortune, landing on lists celebrating best places to work and fastest growing private companies. The primary goal of our award-winning team is to have a positive impact on the lives of the clients we are honored to serve. We want our values to shine through every interaction, all conversations, and in every service we provide. We continue to find ways to do more and be better because our clients deserve it. 

All team members, wherever they start, have access to our leadership team, which is focused on their success. Through regular one-on-one check-ins and team huddles, we define clear professional goals and strive to meet them together and individually. Coastal nurtures growth for those willing to put in the work. If you're passionate about values, eager to impact the community, and ready to grow personally and professionally you'll be right at home. 

Coastal Payroll Services is seeking a dynamic and experienced Business Systems Analyst with a focus on Salesforce to join our team. This role will play a vital part in analyzing business processes, identifying areas for improvement, and implementing solutions to enhance efficiency and effectiveness across our organization. In addition to traditional business analysis responsibilities, this position will be responsible for assisting in the development of our Salesforce platform, writing reports, and providing user training.

**WHAT YOU'LL DO**

*Business Systems Analysis:*

* Analyze existing business processes, systems, and workflows to identify opportunities for improvement.
* Develop detailed business requirements, functional specifications, and system design documents.
* Translate user problems, issues, and needs into viable technical solutions.

*Salesforce Development:*

* Collaborate with stakeholders to understand business needs and requirements for Salesforce customization and development.
* Assist in the design, configuration, and implementation of Salesforce solutions to improve business processes and enhance user experience.
* Customize Salesforce objects, fields, workflows, and validation rules to meet business requirements.

*Report Writing:*

* Design and develop reports and dashboards in Salesforce to provide actionable insights for business users and management.
* Create custom reports and analytical tools to support decision-making processes and monitor key performance indicators (KPIs).

*User Training and Support:*

* Provide end-user training and support to ensure effective utilization of Salesforce and other business systems.
* Create training materials, documentation, and user guides to facilitate user adoption and proficiency.

*Collaboration and Communication:*

* Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including IT, sales, and operations, to implement and support integrated solutions.
* Communicate effectively with stakeholders to ensure alignment of Salesforce initiatives with broader company objectives.
* Build and maintain strong listening, summarizing, facilitating, and "Bridge Building" skills.

*Project Management:*

* Ability to manage multiple projects of varying priorities and deadlines.
* Communicate effectively with stakeholders to ensure alignment of Salesforce initiatives with broader company objectives.

**WHAT YOU'LL BRING**

* Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience in Business Administration, Information Systems, or Computer Science.
* 2+ years as a Business Systems Analyst, with a focus on Salesforce administration and development and/or 2+ years of experience in HR, Payroll, or Finance systems.
* Salesforce certifications (e.g., Salesforce Administrator, Salesforce Developer) a plus.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to translate business requirements into technical solutions.
* Experience in report writing and data analysis using Salesforce reporting tools.
* Excellent communication, interpersonal, and stakeholder management skills.
* Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.

**WHAT WE OFFER**

* $70k - $75k
* Medical, dental, and vision insurance
* 401(k) retirement plan with company match
* Paid time off and holidays
* Employee referral bonus program
* Work from home options
* Incredible Culture: Coastal Payroll Services, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer, drug-free workplace, and complies with ADA regulations as applicable.

**Join Our Team:** If you are passionate about leveraging technology to drive business success and are ready to make an impact at Coastal Payroll Services, we invite you to apply for the Business Systems Analyst position. Please submit your resume and cover letter outlining your qualifications and experience.

title: Senior Data Systems Analyst
description:
**Senior Data Systems Analyst**

Hybrid 3 days/week, Full time M-F 8am-5pm PST

Being authorized to work in the U.S. is a precondition of employment.

National Funding does not consider candidates requiring 1099 or C2C.

Exempt Salary Range: $101,000-$151,000 + Position eligible for additional incentives including Bonus, 401(k) match, health and welfare benefits, amazing culture, growth opportunity and more!!

Location: San Diego, CA (La Jolla/UTC)

National Funding is continuing to grow its Data Analytics Department and has an exciting opportunity for aSenior **Data Systems Analyst**. Reporting to the Director of BI, the Senior **Data Systems Analyst** is a data-driven, highly logical individual with excellent investigative skills. This individual utilizes these skills alongside their technical experience to understand how the business' systems use and generate data. With that knowledge, they provide solutions supporting the data team's projects. They work directly with the business and product teams to understand applications as well as the data engineering, business intelligence and data science teams to design solutions to drive business strategy and advanced analytics.

**Major Responsibilities:**

* Identify and understand data requirements of the business; supplement with strategic thought partnership to ensure long term scalability
* Support data modeling efforts in normalized data warehouse, analytics data marts, and source applications to ensure efficiency and completion
* Identify accurate sources of data from varying systems through collaboration with the business, technical teams and self-investigation; create source to target mapping documentation to be used by technical and non-technical teams
* Write ELT/ETL packages to load data into varying layers of the Snowflake Data Warehouse as well as sharing data with internal and external stakeholders
* Break down business requirements into concise JIRA tickets
* Document logic and data lineage for usability by technical and non-technical teams
* Analyze the quality of the data and suggest temporary resolutions as well as long term fixes
* Utilize metadata to QA and validate data, automate processes and align technical logic with business definitions

**Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities Required:** 

* Lead Level Candidate
* Minimum 7+ years of experience in analytics, data, or technical role
* Advanced knowledge of Snowflake, SQL
* Advanced knowledge of Data Warehousing, ETL Design, Data Modeling
* Advanced knowledge of Tableau, Salesforce
* Experienced in dbt, SSIS, Python, PySpark,
* Experienced in Finance Industry, Underwriting, and/or Credit Risk and Portfolio Performance
* Experienced in enterprise data management and metadata management
* Proven exceptional analytical and problem-solving skills
* Outstanding communication skills with both technical and non-technical colleagues

W**hy National Funding?**

* Growing, successful company preparing to almost double in size over the next three years (this is your opportunity to get in on the ground floor)
* Positive, energetic, passionate, business casual environment with management who committed to your success
* Fantastic benefits package including a 401(k) match
* Numerous employee events throughout the year, including our annual traditions such as a Day at the Del Mar Racetrack, Holiday Party, Employee and Family Picnic, sporting events and more.

National Funding serves the small business community. Since 1999, we have provided more than $3 billion in funding to over 50,000 customers to support their working capital and equipment financing needs. We are one of the country's largest private providers of small business loans, having funded more than $3 billion to help small businesses grow. Our personal approach helps strengthen small business owners and we pride ourselves on being a resource they can trust. We are believers in small business owners.  


National Funding is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

title: Clinical Quality Management Data Analyst
description:
**WELCOME TO YOUR CENTER!**

  
Established as a community non-profit in 1972, The Center provides targeted programs and services to the full diversity of the San Diego LGBTQ community. The mission of The Center is to enhance and sustain the health and well-being of the lesbian, gay, bisexual, queer, transgender, nonbinary, immigrant, and HIV communities for the betterment of our entire San Diego region. Our vision is to create a Center and Center culture where every person feels and knows that they are welcomed, valued, and supported. As the beacon for our regional LGBTQ community, we actively recommit to being a more vibrant, bold, innovative, safe, and modern center each day than the day before. The Center is sex-positive and provides advocacy and critical health and social support services to support our community members through all stages of life, focusing on our deeply held values of equity, social justice, and client-centered, trauma-informed care. The Center currently has over 75 staff working at five facilities across San Diego County.

  
**As of 04/01/2023, the Center has relaxed its COVID-19 vaccination requirement for employment. New employees are encouraged but not required to be vaccinated. The Centre reserves the right to amend this requirement based on health concerns and/or governmental recommendations to protect the well-being of our community. If this requirement changes, employees will have 30 days to comply.**

  
**POSITION SUMMARY**

Under the supervision of the Clinical Quality Management Manager, the CQM Data Analyst provides clinical quality management support to contracted providers of Ryan White-funded HIV services, to the HIV, STD, and Hepatitis Branch's (HSHB) Ryan White program, to the HIV Planning Group, and to the HIV Clinical Quality Management Committee. This position is also responsible for assisting with special projects as assigned by the Clinical Quality Management Manager.

  
**PRIMARY ROLES & RESPONSIBILITIES:** 

* **Maintenance and Support for Program-Related Data Reporting Systems**
+ Ensure the completeness of HIV program data to be used in reporting, analysis, planning, evaluation, and clinical quality management.
+ Develop, implement, and maintain XML export schemas for each contract requiring exporting and importing functionality.
+ Import services and personal health information into data reporting systems, including ARIES, to support Ryan White service providers.

* **Training and Technical Assistance to Assist Service Providers**
+ Provide technical assistance and training related to the AIDS Regional Information and Evaluation System (ARIES).
+ Provide written status updates regarding timeliness, completeness, and conformance of provider export files and provider technical assistance and training requests.
+ Act as a liaison between the County of San Diego and the ARIES Support Team at the California Department of Public Health.
+ Assist with the installation of electronic certificates for ARIES users and manage user account access.

* **Provide Data Analysis and Report Development**
+ Ensure the completeness of program data to be used in reporting, analysis, planning, evaluation, and clinical quality management.
+ Coordinate data reporting from ARIES to support contractors, including data required to develop and submit monthly progress reports.
+ Provide data analysis to support HSHB activities, state and federal reporting requirements, grant applications, and requests of the HIV Planning Group.
+ Coordinate the annual Ryan White Services Report with HSHB, including identifying missing/incomplete data and resolving discrepancies with contracted HIV service providers.
+ Complete routine and non-routine reports as requested by HSHB to support planning, reporting, and evaluation of HIV services.

  
**Required Qualifications:**

* Education/Experience: A minimum of four years' experience related to database management, data support, analysis, or training and technical assistance; or a certificate, associate's degree, or bachelor's degree with transferable skills. Must have demonstrated ability to analyze, organize, and interpret data.
* Professional Skills: Exceptional critical thinking and analysis skills; ability to interact with various types of populations; strong organizational and planning skills; excellent interpersonal communication skills; ability to manage multiple tasks with shifting priorities, attentive and amiable customer service skills; and ability to track and report on goals.
* Personal Skills: Detail-oriented; inquisitive; self-motivated; teachable; collaborative; amicable and personable; familiarity with the LGBTQ+ communities and the work of The Center.
* Technology Skills: Must be comfortable working in PC/Windows-based environments. Must have proficiency with Microsoft Office, particularly Word, Outlook, and Excel. Familiarity with Excel functions, including but not limited to, V-lookups, Pivot Tables, and Power Query.
* Language Skills: Fluency in English.

  
**preferred QUALIFICATIONS:**

* Education/Experience: Experience conducting database and quality management activities in a health care setting preferred. Knowledge of current HIV service providers and HIV prevention programs in San Diego is preferred.
* Technology Skills: Familiarity with Tableau and Power BI is also preferred, but not required.
* Language Skills: Fluency in Spanish.

  
**COMPENSATION & BENEFITS:** 

* **Compensation**: The pay range for this position is $27.85 - $30.00 an hour and is commensurate with experience. This is a Full-Time Regular Non-Exempt position.
* **Benefits**: The CENTER offers a robust benefits package, inclusive of Competitive Pay Scales, 401(k) Retirement Plan (with company match), Full Medical, Dental, Vision, and Chiropractic Health Coverage, Out-of-Pocket Optional Coverage for Spouses, Domestic Partners, and Dependent Children, Group Term Life Insurance, Full-time and Part-Time Schedules, Generous Vacation and Holiday Benefits, Professional Training & Development Experiences, Opportunities for Promotion & Advancement

  
Please review the current job openings by clicking the button below. If you believe you possess the heart and skills for any of these (or any other) exciting job opportunities, we encourage you to apply. Instructions for how to apply are included in each job announcement. We regret that we are unable to accept telephone inquiries.

  
**Equal Opportunity Employer**

The San Diego LGBTQ Community Center is an equal opportunity employer to all, regardless of age, ancestry, color, disability (mental and physical), exercising the right to family care and medical leave, gender, gender expression, gender identity, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, military or veteran status, national origin, political affiliation, race, religious creed, sex (includes pregnancy, childbirth, breastfeeding, and related medical conditions), and sexual orientation.

title: Data Analyst - Ad Tech - Remote - Remote
description:
About Motive InteractiveMotive Interactive is one of the top Mobile Ad Networks in the world, come join a team with an amazing future. Motive is seeking creative, driven, and out of the box thinkers to join our growing distributed workforce. 

Motive has been recognized by numerous publications including Inc. Magazine as one of the fastest growing companies in the United States. Motive is at the forefront of Mobile App Marketing and a proven leader in user acquisition for apps.

Responsibilities* Analyze and interpret data using a range of analysis and presentation tools and make recommendations for actions to optimize marketing performance
* Apply expertise in quantitative analysis, data mining, and the presentation of data to see beyond the numbers and guide applicable next steps
* Run A/B testing and statistical analyses to extract actionable insights that influence, support, and assist in models development
* Develop and present learnings from analyses, including actionable insights and recommendations
* Create reports guided by reporting framework and take ownership of maintaining campaign reports
* Ad Hoc analysis to support sales techniques, marketing strategies, and campaign optimization Minimum Qualifications
* Manage data system to reliably handle 30k-50k transactions per second
* Interface with other developers, sales, and traffic teams to understand data needs
* Define and manage all data sets
* Own the whole data infrastructure

Requirements* BS in Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Engineering or other related fields is a plus
* 3-5 years’ predictive modeling experience in a professional setting, using tools such as Python, R or SQL
* Experience with AWS data tools (Redshift, EMR, s3)
* Experience with NoSQL database (MongoDB, Aerospike)
* Ability to analyze data to identify optimizations, gaps and inconsistencies.
* Excellent communication skills including the ability to identify and communicate data driven insights.

title: Analyst-Digital Category Management
description:
Please note, the ideal candidate for this role will need to be located in a commutable distance from our **corporate office in Mooresville, NC** or be open to relocation, as eligible.


The role of Analyst, Digital Category Management is to strategically evaluate the online experience for customers while also evaluating the industry to create and test data driven ways to improve upon the customer’s shopping experience with Lowe’s. The Analyst will review internal and external research and/or benchmarking, review/analyze customer information and other relevant data, conduct analysis, and provide insights and recommendations all to identify areas of improvement for the customer shopping experience. The Analyst will track, analyze, and report on key performance metrics to ensure activities within their assigned area are meeting strategic and financial objectives.

**What You Will Do**  

* Responsible for gathering and compiling competitive intelligence and data in a cohesive manner
* Interprets analysis across a variety of factors and provides data driven recommendations help inform project plans
* Accountable for implementation of tactics in assigned projects
* Effectively communicates project plans and needs with partner teams to help ensure all plans and programs are aligned with department strategies
* Builds in depth reports using data tools like Adobe Analytics
* Conducts industry research and develops functional knowledge
* Supports meetings with Online and Core Merchants to deliver insights to guide future strategies, tactics, or activities
* Works as a member of a larger team
* Analyze data from Adobe and other reporting suite to inform decisioning
* Executes tactical plans to address observed customer opportunities

  

**Required Qualifications**  

* Bachelors Degree Business Administration, Marketing, Finance, or related field (or equivalent work experience in related field)
* 2-3 years relevant experience
* 2 Years Ecommerce, Omni-Channel merchandising/marketing, Brand or Product Management Experience

  

**Preferred Qualifications*** Adobe analytics, PowerBI, Google analytics Experience
* 1-2 years Ecommerce, Omni-Channel merchandising/marketing, Brand or Product Management Experience

**About Lowe’s**


Lowe’s Companies, Inc. (NYSE: LOW) is a FORTUNE® 50 home improvement company serving approximately 16 million customer transactions a week in the United States. With total fiscal year 2023 sales of more than $86 billion, Lowe’s operates over 1,700 home improvement stores and employs approximately 300,000 associates. Based in Mooresville, N.C., Lowe’s supports the communities it serves through programs focused on creating safe, affordable housing and helping to develop the next generation of skilled trade experts. For more information, visit Lowes.com.

*Lowe’s is an equal opportunity employer and administers all personnel practices without regard to race, color, religious creed, sex, gender, age, ancestry, national origin, mental or physical disability or medical condition, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, military or veteran status, genetic information, or any other category protected under federal, state, or local law.*


Pay Range for CA, CO, HI, NJ, NY, WA: $58,100.00 - $96,900.00 annually Starting rate of pay may vary based on factors including, but not limited to, position offered, location, education, training, and/or experience. For information regarding our benefit programs and eligibility, please visit https://talent.lowes.com/us/en/benefits.

title: Data Product Integrity Specialist - Enterprise Data Assets Production Support Analyst
description:
This is where your true career begins. We ranked #2 on the 2023 LinkedIn Top Companies list - and #1 among financial services companies - as the best workplace "to grow your career" in the U.S. At Wells Fargo, we support employees' career aspirations and growth. We're proud of our employee-welfare-centered business approach and our commitment to diversity, equity, and inclusion in the workplace.  

  

**About this role:**  

  

Wells Fargo is seeking a **Data Product Integrity Specialist** within Data Management & Insights division. The Data Product Integrity Specialist will be part of the Enterprise Instrumental Data Foundation (eIDF) Operations Team within Data Management & Insights division.
  

  

The eIDF's Operational mission is to provide leadership and operational / execution support to deliver reliable, well-governed data across the enterprise. This position will actively manage data used to modernize the distribution and curation of Wells Fargo reporting solutions across multiple domains. In addition, drive the delivery of reliable data for strategic data centric decision making, business growth, regulatory reporting and risk management  

  

**In this role, you will:*** Act as a data steward; participate in low to moderate complexity data integrity and quality initiatives and reviews of business systems; identify opportunities for process improvement with business systems
* Review and analyze basic data quality audits with low to moderate risk; research and resolve data quality issues related to systems, data sets and data connections
* Present recommendations for resolving low to moderate complexity data quality issues and exercise independent judgment while developing expertise in the data quality standards and control framework; escalate and remediate low to moderate complexity data quality issues
* Collaborate and consult with business, risk partners, and technical staff, including Enterprise Data Management and Technology functions, to triage and remediate data quality issues
* Ensure compliance with Enterprise Data Management policies, standards, and technology and facilitate execution of business data standards and control frameworks
* Understand the complete data lifecycle from data creation and capture to data processing, storage, and usage
* Identify and track end-to-end data lineage using traditional methods and systemic tools
* Actively engage in identifying solutions to improve data and implement data quality improvement plans

**Required Qualifications:*** 2+ years of data quality or data management experience, or equivalent demonstrated through one or a combination of the following: work experience, training, military experience, education
* 1+ years of SQL Experience
* 1+ year of experience in data management related areas such as metadata or lineage, data governance or data quality
* 1+ years of experience with data analysis and documentation

**Desired Qualifications:*** Experience working with various Data Platforms to include Consumer, Commercial, Securities & Derivatives, Deposits, Party and Reference Data
* Experience working within a complex cross domain programs/projects
* Ability to leverage complex Tableau, Power BI and other reporting / dashboard technologies to deliver concise analytic results to management
* Experience with data quality, using data dictionaries, lineage, data mapping and other tools in support of complex data defect research, triage, and monitoring
* Demonstrated experience in risk identification and business process improvement

**Posting End Date:**
  

30 Mar 2024  

**\*Job posting may come down early due to volume of applicants.**
  

  

**We Value Diversity**  

  

At Wells Fargo, we believe in diversity, equity and inclusion in the workplace; accordingly, we welcome applications for employment from all qualified candidates, regardless of race, color, gender, national origin, religion, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information, individuals with disabilities, pregnancy, marital status, status as a protected veteran or any other status protected by applicable law.  

  

Employees support our focus on building strong customer relationships balanced with a strong risk mitigating and compliance-driven culture which firmly establishes those disciplines as critical to the success of our customers and company. They are accountable for execution of all applicable risk programs (Credit, Market, Financial Crimes, Operational, Regulatory Compliance), which includes effectively following and adhering to applicable Wells Fargo policies and procedures, appropriately fulfilling risk and compliance obligations, timely and effective escalation and remediation of issues, and making sound risk decisions. There is emphasis on proactive monitoring, governance, risk identification and escalation, as well as making sound risk decisions commensurate with the business unit's risk appetite and all risk and compliance program requirements.  

  

Candidates applying to job openings posted in US: All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, status as a protected veteran, or any other legally protected characteristic.  

  

Candidates applying to job openings posted in Canada: Applications for employment are encouraged from all qualified candidates, including women, persons with disabilities, aboriginal peoples and visible minorities. Accommodation for applicants with disabilities is available upon request in connection with the recruitment process.  

  

**Applicants with Disabilities**  

  

To request a medical accommodation during the application or interview process, visit Disability Inclusion at Wells Fargo .  

  

**Drug and Alcohol Policy**  

  

Wells Fargo maintains a drug free workplace. Please see our Drug and Alcohol Policy to learn more.

title: Lead Data Management Analyst (contract)
description:
**Title****:** Lead Data Management Analyst

**Location****:**

Charlotte, NC

**Duration****:** 12 months

**Work Engagement****:** W2

**Benefits on offer for this contract position**: Health Insurance, Life insurance, 401K and Voluntary Benefits

 **Summary:**


Organize and lead companywide initiatives to ensure that data quality is maintained so that data can effectively support business processes. Oversee analysis and reporting in support of regulatory requirements. Identify and recommend analysis of data quality or integrity issues. Evaluate data quality metrics and data quality audits to benchmark the state of data quality. Adhere to data governance standards and procedures. Identify new data sources and develop recommendations for assessing the quality of new data. Lead project teams and mentor less experienced staff members. Recommend remediation of process or control gaps that align to management strategy. Serve as relationship manager for a line of business. Consult with and provide recommendations to senior management regarding assessments of the current state of data and metadata quality within area of assigned responsibility. Represent client in cross-functional groups to develop companywide data governance strategies. Partner with groups and various levels of seniority companywide to coordinate and drive collaboration on solution design and remediation execution.

 **Responsibilities:**

* Lead team activities to complete data aggregation, preparation, and validation in support of regulatory report production.
* Build and maintain working relationships with upstream data sources, business users, and technology teams to partner on BAU change management and data projects
* Develop and execute SQL queries to extract data from ERA databases and perform analyses
* Execute change management impact assessments and support BAU change management impacting ERA

 **Qualifications:**

* Applicants must be authorized to work for ANY employer in the U.S. This position is not eligible for visa sponsorship.
* Advanced SQL skills (preferably expertise with Teradata)
* Microsoft office skills (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Visio)
* Strong verbal and written communication skills
* Strong analytical skills with high attention to detail and accuracy
* Strong problem-solving skills

title: BCBA (Board Certified Behavior Analyst)- Concord, NC
Associate, Consumer Experience Analyst | Red Ventures
Clinical Analyst - Associate
description:
**Overview**


**Job Summary**


Assesses clinical synthesis, distributes and analyzes internal and comparative data to proactively lead improvement opportunities in enterprise-wide clinical performance and outcomes. Ensures submission standards are met for the appropriate governing entities (e.g. CMS, TJC, other national clinical registries).  

  

  

**Essential Functions**

  

* Ensures integrity, accuracy, validity and comprehensiveness of data.
* Collects data from electronic and paper documents.
* Verifies accuracy of collected data and adheres to standards; requires the ability to resolve conflicts with data and detailed understanding of data definitions.
* Presents statistical information.
* Uses statistical techniques to describe and evaluate data and uses process analysis tools for the display, interpretation and presentation of data for management and organization action.
* Determines data needs and preferred data source.
* Defines report needs.
* Assists in development of program(s) to create reports.
* Evaluates report requests and provides reports as requested to customers.
* Participates in development of data variables, collection processes, standards, and data dictionaries.
* Works with internal and external data providers to ensure accurate data is available in a timely and accessible manner.
* Integrates standards of care/clinical guidelines/protocols in collaboration with multidisciplinary groups and evaluates for process and outcomes improvement.
* Identifies opportunities that impede attainment of clinical performance and outcomes.
* Participates in enterprise wide, multidisciplinary group activities (ex: QSOC, Medical Staff Quality, Disease Specific).
* Works on practice and process improvements.
* Analyzes data to identify patterns and trends areas for improvement.
* Facilitates and serves as a resource for the development and implementation of action plans for process and practice improvements.
* Reports analysis of data and incorporates findings into the development of action plans.
* Measures and evaluates implemented changes/actions.
* Reports demonstrated efficiency and quality of improved patient care, system processes and professional practices to key stakeholders.
* Provides educational offerings for staff and physicians related to quality topics.
* Participates in general orientation for new employees, as requested.

**Physical Requirements**  


Most of work in office environment using office equipment (computers, copiers, etc). This position requires a lot of sitting and working at the computer. There are periods of intense detail and deadlines. Each employee has the responsibility to work in a safe manner. **Education, Experience and Certifications**

  

Bachelor's degree in health related fields or RN required. 5 years experience in health related field required. Experience with healthcare data in a healthcare organization strongly preferred. Competent with personal computers and database management. Good knowledge of nursing documentation practices and resource tools Understands medical terminology including diagnosis and procedure codes. Understands patient identification processes and processes in patient management. Ability to successfully complete generic, department, and database-specific skills. Maintains professional competency and licensure, if applicable.

title: Quantitative Finance Analyst -Financial Crimes Data Analyst
description:
**Job Description:**


The position is part of the Enterprise Risk Analytics (ERA) model development team for Anti-Money Laundering (AML) detection models. These models identify potentially suspicious behaviors for further evaluation by our in-house investigation teams. This area has a unique appetite for a wide scope of model methodologies, from simple rules-based models to advanced machine learning and AI models which facilitates opportunities for both immediate, effective contribution on team priorities and personal development through exposure to advanced modeling techniques. Our statistical toolkit includes various numerical procedures, with a recent emphasis on enhancing custom, AML domain-specific performance testing and evaluation capabilities. Python and PySpark serve as our primary programming languages, in addition to SQL for extracting data from Hadoop and other databases.  

  

The Role will interact with a wide variety of stakeholders including Financial Crimes Investigations, business risk managers, model developers, model risk management, model implementation, and technology teams.  

  

As a Quantitative Finance Analyst within Enterprise Risk Analytics - AML model development team, the main responsibilities will include:

* Identifying and applying statistical techniques to support innovative, enhanced granularity of risk management capabilities
* Developing quantitative methods to support granular detection capabilities that meet risk management, line of business, and regulatory requirements
* Performing in-depth analysis on the Bank’s AML model suite and clearly articulating a holistic picture of model performance
* Communicating model performance to model stakeholders, including risk management, model development, model risk, and senior management with clear conclusions regarding accuracy and remediation areas as required
* Demonstrated ability to clearly articulate to senior stakeholders quantitative solutions that are designed to drive the business forward by addressing critical business problems"

**Required Skills**

* Graduate degree in quantitative discipline (e.g. Mathematics, Economics, Engineering, Finance, Physics)
* 2+ years of experience in model development, statistical work, data analytics or quantitative research or PhD
* Strong Programming skills e.g. R, Python, SAS, SQL or other languages
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills

 **Desired Skills**

* Knowledge of predictive modeling, statistical sampling, optimization, machine learning and artificial intelligence techniques
* Strong technical writing, communication and presentation skills and ability to effectively communicate quantitative topics with non-technical audiences
* Experience with large data sets
* Effective at prioritization/time and project management
* Broad understanding of financial products

**Shift:**


1st shift (United States of America)**Hours Per Week:**


40

title: Financial Data Analyst
description:
Salary: DOE  
Job Title: Financial Data Analyst

Company: Elevate Eyecare 

Location: Remote

Job Type: Full-time

Salary Range: TBD

 

Overview: We are seeking a talented and detail-oriented Financial Data Analyst to join our dynamic team at Elevate Eyecare. As a Financial Data Analyst, you will play a crucial role in analyzing financial data, identifying trends, and providing valuable insights to support strategic decision-making within the organization. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in finance, exceptional analytical skills, and a passion for leveraging data to drive business growth and profitability.

 

Responsibilities:

1. Collect, analyze, and interpret financial data from various sources, including financial statements, databases, and market research reports.
2. Develop and maintain financial models, forecasts, and projections to support budgeting, planning, and decision-making processes.
3. Identify key financial metrics and KPIs to monitor business performance and profitability.
4. Conduct variance analysis to identify trends, opportunities, and areas for improvement.
5. Prepare comprehensive financial reports and presentations for senior management and key stakeholders.
6. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather data and insights for strategic initiatives and projects.
7. Assist in the development and implementation of financial systems and processes to streamline data collection and reporting.
8. Stay up-to-date with industry trends, regulations, and best practices in financial analysis and reporting.
9. Provide ad-hoc analysis and support for special projects and initiatives as needed.

 

Requirements:

1. Bachelor's degree in Finance, Accounting, Economics, or a related field. (Master's degree or CPA/CFA certification is a plus)
2. Proven experience as a Financial Analyst, Data Analyst, or similar role, preferably in the healthcare or medical industry.
3. Strong proficiency in financial modeling, data analysis, and statistical techniques.
4. Advanced skills in Microsoft Excel, including pivot tables, VLOOKUP, and financial functions. Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau or Power BI is a plus.
5. Solid understanding of financial principles, accounting standards, and financial statements.
6. Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and critical thinking skills.
7. Ability to work independently, manage multiple priorities, and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment.
8. Strong communication and presentation skills, with the ability to convey complex financial information to non-financial stakeholders.
9. Attention to detail and a commitment to accuracy and integrity in financial reporting and analysis.

 

Join our team at Elevate Eyecare and make a meaningful impact on the financial performance and success of our organization. We offer competitive compensation, benefits, and opportunities for professional growth and development. Apply now to be part of our dynamic team!

title: Business Data Analyst
description:
Job Description  
  
 JOB SUMMARY  
 The Business Data Analyst provides strategic and tactical support to the enterprise by analyzing and interpreting data for solutions. Develops rules and methodologies for effective Data Management. Uses knowledge of data analysis tools and other technology to provide data integration solutions. They are responsible for the development of an in-depth understanding and analysis of the data requirements for projects and ad-hoc reporting and analysis needs. This position influences senior management, technical leads and architects in achieving strategic goals by facilitating the data availability and quality of systems and processes. Provides technical and professional assistance for less experienced team members.   
  
RESPONSIBILITIES  
  
• Competencies:  
  
• Responsible for both leading and participating in a team of analysts focused on the analysis, design, implementation, and follow up of the migration of data from the on-premises Enterprise Data Warehouse to the Azure Data Warehouse.  
  
• Leads and directs the work of others.  
  
• Lead research, planning, development and testing of data provisioning, analysis and ad-hoc reporting solutions.  
  
• Participates in developing the methodology for documenting data templates for various types of data.  
  
• The ability to extract and analyze data, patterns, and related trends, with the subsequent ability to synthesize the data into information consumable by senior business decisionmakers.  
  
• Reviews and ensures that major data architectural designs are consistent, maintainable, flexible and cost effective.  
  
• Understands industry trends, emerging technologies and standards in order to evolve the Standards and Roadmap.  
  
• Provides analysis to support development of vision, data strategy, data architecture and the overall design and development of Enterprise Data Warehouse as needed.  
  
• Provides consultation to application owners, business partners and peer groups regarding long and short-range data solutions that meet business requirements.  
  
• Diagnoses data problems effectively and determines solution options with consideration to business impact.  
  
• Adheres to enterprise architecture strategies, principals, standards, policies and procedures. Understands and ensures compliance with IT strategy.  
  
• Diagnose and fix bugs, performance and security issues  
  
• Be a champion of digital security at TTX  
  
• Ensure resources diagnose and fix bugs, performance and security issues  
  
• Document system architecture o Improve the overall quality and security of any related systems  
  
• Ensure access to data follows the principle of least privilege as required  
  
• Professional:  
  
• Follows through with commitments.  
  
• Proactively initiates, develops, and maintains effective working relationships with team members.  
  
• Relies on extensive experience and judgment to plan and accomplish goals.  
  
• Demonstrates the ability to cooperate with a variety of people and achieve results.  
  
• Works independently with personnel at all levels and follows departmental standards.  
  
• Works closely with management to prioritize business and information needs.  
  
• Self-starter - must be productive with minimal direction  
  
• Ability to work in a fast-paced, technical, cross-functional environment o Excellent visual design sense regarding clear and accurate presentation of data  
  
• Personal:  
  
• Accurately prepares written business correspondence that is coherent, grammatically correct, effective and professional.  
  
• Clearly articulates ideas and thoughts verbally.  
  
• Ability to manage changing priorities.  
  
• Shares acquired skills with team members through formal and informal channels  
  
QUALIFICATIONS  
  
• Bachelor's degree or equivalent and work experience defined as 5-7 or more years of overall experience with data analysis for major software systems.  
  
• Excellent knowledge of data requirements for the Railroad Industry.  
  
• Ability to quickly assess the impact of data changes on the business, application relationships and information flow.  
  
• Must be a self-starter with the skills required to be able to motivate and influence across all levels of the organization.  
  
• Ability to function as a thought leader for Microsoft Power BI.  
  
• Strong ability to facilitate collaboration among senior technical team members and senior business leaders.  
  
• Ability to use advanced analytic tools to develop predictive models.  
  
• Experience defining and implementing information and data architecture governance, including acting as a design authority for information and data within projects and programs.  
  
• Effective use of data analysis tools (SQL, Power BI, Tableau, etc.) to access and manipulate data across a range of database and information platforms.  
  
• Ability to lead, motivate and participate in cross functional teams, providing mentoring and support to junior team members.  
  
• Ability to define and manage the scope of data tasks and execute projects on time and within budget, escalating exceptions in a timely manner.  
  
• Excellent interpersonal and communications skills - lead, collaborate, facilitate, and negotiate as necessary.  
  
• Ability to work flexible hours during key implementation activities.  
  
PHYSICAL JOB REQUIREMENTS  
  
(The physical demands and work environment characteristics described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable qualified individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.)  
  
General office environment; may be required to travel. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to talk or hear. The employee frequently is required to sit (remain stationary within work area) and use hands to finger, handle, feel and reach. The employee is occasionally required to move about (stand, walk). The employee must occasionally lift and/or transport up to 10 pounds. Correctable vision required for close, distance, and color vision capabilities.  
  
The above job description is intended to describe the general content of and requirements for the performance of this job. It is not to be construed as an exhaustive statement of duties, responsibilities or requirements.  
  
About Us  
  
 TTX Company is a leading provider of railcars and related freight car management services to the North American rail industry. TTX's pool of railcars is ideal for supporting shippers in the intermodal, automotive, paper & forest, metals, machinery, wind energy and other markets where flatcars, boxcars and gondolas are required.   
  
TTX's generous Total Rewards package includes Paid Time Off, Health, Dental and Vision benefits, and 401(k) with company match. This position participates in Railroad Retirement.  
  
TTX Company is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer.  
  
About the Team  
  
 What we do:  
  
Achieve strategic business value by leading and supporting TTX's Digital Transformation, including cloud solutions, intelligent real-time analytics, machine learning and mobility. * Supports daily business operations via systems and data
* Develops and/or provides hardware and software to run business
* Provide maintenance and trouble-shooting for business systems
* Special projects to transform business operations and meet business needs
* Provide Cybersecurity for TTX and its information assets.

title: Domo Data Analyst (REMOTE)
description:
Everlight Solar is seeking a skilled Data Analyst who will design and maintain functional programs and applications, producing fully functional software applications according to requirements. As a Data Analyst, you play a key role in serving our clients and team members. This will be a full-time, work-from-home "remote" position.

**This is a role for Apple power-users, must know iWork and be skilled with iOS and macOS.**

Everlight Solar is a rapidly growing company and the leader of solar energy in the Midwest. We offer a unique experience that fosters individual growth and rewards performance. Our culture at Everlight is extremely important to us. The work environment is fast-paced and dynamic. We value teamwork, quality, innovation, and customer success. Our ideal candidate is self-motivated, detail-oriented, has excellent problem-solving abilities, is passionate about delivering results on-time, exceeding expectations, and ensuring success for our teams.

**Responsibilities:**

* Work with large amounts of data to draw meaningful conclusions
* Develop and implement data collection systems and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and data quality
* Provide regular reporting and analysis to team
* Develop and maintain dashboards and reports to track key metrics and performance indicators
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify areas for improvement and to develop solutions to enhance business operations
* Provide training and support to team members on data analysis techniques and tools

**Requirements:**

* Minimum two years of experience with DOMO
* MajorDOMO Certification Required
* 3+ years experience in data analysis, reporting, business intelligence or financial analysis and a Bachelor's Degree in Business, Statistics, Mathematics, Analytics, Computer Sciences or related field or equivalent experience
* 2 years experience in providing people analytics reporting to organizations
* Demonstrated experience using SQL, and DOMO
* Experience with sensitive and confidential people data in a global environment
* Analyze, evaluate, improve, and document processes and workflows. Identify and take advantage of opportunities for process automation and simplification.
* Proven ability to design and implement new processes and facilitate user adoption.
* Strong understanding of Salesforce.com best practices and functionality
* Strong data management abilities
* A documented history of successfully driving projects to completion
* A demonstrated ability to understand and articulate complex requirements
* Excellent project management skills and a positive attitude
* Must demonstrate exceptional verbal and written communication skills
* Must demonstrate ability to communicate effectively at all levels of the organization
* Must own a Mac computer and be fluent with the Apple ecosystem of software (iOS, macOS, iWork, etc.)

**Benefits:**  


* Health Insurance
* Dental Insurance
* Vision Insurance
* Life Insurance
* PTO
* Sick and Safe Time
* Paid Holidays Off

**Salary: $65,000-$100,000/ year**

*Everlight Solar is proudly an Equal Opportunity Employer. We value diversity of all types and are excited to work with talented individuals from a wide range of backgrounds. Everlight is committed to inclusion and we invite people of any race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality or sex, age groups (18+), and levels of education to apply. Authorized to work in the US and background check required.*

title: Data Analyst
description:
We're seeking a sharp and collaborative Data Analyst to join our team and play a key role in optimizing our core products. You'll leverage your analytical expertise to generate actionable recommendations, build impactful algorithms, and create informative reports – all with the goal of driving customer engagement and business growth.

**Responsibilities:**

* Partner with stakeholders across the organization to identify areas for improvement and design A/B tests for user experiences and marketing campaigns.
* Collaborate with analysts and data scientists to develop algorithms that enhance click-through rates and conversion metrics.
* Craft compelling reports and dashboards using data science, data mining, and statistical methods.
* Perform essential data engineering tasks to support your analytical endeavors.
* Translate business needs into actionable data analysis and optimization recommendations.
* Communicate complex findings clearly and effectively to stakeholders at all levels.
* Provide high-level insights and granular segment analysis to internal teams.
* Leverage existing data to forecast the impact of future initiatives and recommend optimal courses of action.

**Qualifications:**

* 2+ years of experience in analytics, data engineering, data science, or a related field.
* Mastery of Microsoft Excel, with advanced skills a plus.
* Proficiency in SQL or another programming language.
* Meticulous attention to detail, with strong analytical and reporting capabilities.
* Ability to translate complex data into clear, actionable insights.
* Exceptional data visualization and communication skills for all audience levels.
* Strong organizational skills and the ability to manage multiple tasks effectively in a fast-paced environment.

title: Business Data Analyst
description:
Our client, a Fortune 1000 financial services company is looking for Business Data Analysts.   
  
Business Data Analysts are responsible for coordinating with internal stakeholders and partners for platform updates and installation of services for retirement plan end clients. End-client retirement plan data is being migrated from an existing internal system to a new internal system. The business data analyst will need to verify that the data migration was successful and correct by performing gap analysis and a quality check on the data in the new internal system. They are responsible to ensure all plan data is ultimately comprehensive, inclusive, and accurate to ensure the enterprise's clients and transitions are successful. There is a QA facet to this role but you will not be running test cases.  
  
This is a 2 year contract role. Our client would prefer a hybrid role, so candidates should live in the areas of Charlotte, Denver or Dallas. But fully remote is also an option. You can come onboard as our W2 or Independent Contractor.   
  
Key Responsibilities and Duties  
• Successfully implement projects for institutional retirement plans with high quality data outcomes  
• Offer consultative data solutions for plan administration challenges  
• Escalate risks and issues for retirement plan implementations in a timely manner.  
• Engage with appropriate resources in a highly-matrixed environment to resolve data issues including client, plan management services and IT.  
  
Work Experience:  
• 3+ Years Required; 5+ Years Preferred  
• Solid experience as an Finance Operations Analyst, business data analyst or operations analyst  
• Financial services experience, retirement plan experience is preferred  
• Agile experience is nice to have  
  
Other Skills:  
• Strong analytical and Excel skills. SQL experience a big plus.  
• Excellent verbal and written skills  
  
Educational Requirements  
• University (Degree) Preferred  
• Series 6 or 7 is a plus

title: IT Data Analyst
description:
**TITLE**

IT Data Analyst

**REPORTING TO**

Sr. Manager, IT Architect 

**SUPERVISORY RESPONSBILITIES**

N/A

**LOCATION**

Charlotte, NC

**THE COMPANY**

*From humble beginnings, GALE Pacific has grown to become a global leader in technical fabrics and consumer products that protect our customers day after day, year after year. With over 600 team members across locations in Australia, New Zealand, USA, China and the UAE, our global presence allows us to continually innovate and build on a rich history dating back to 1951. Our Coolaroo® consumer products sold through major retailers globally include Shade Sails, Shade & Garden Fabrics, Outdoor Blinds and Shade Structures. GALE Pacific Commercial Fabrics include knitted, coated and advanced polymer fabrics used for agriculture, construction, mining and packaging**.*

**OUR VALUES**

* **Integrity**
We do what is right. We are honest and ethical, worthy of the trust of others. It is the price of entry to our team.

 

* **Respect**
Respect guides the way we operate at all levels – with consumers, customers, suppliers, investors, the community, and our own team. 

 

* **Collaboration**
We believe in the power of working together in a collaborative way. Every function and every role is as important as each other.

 

* **People**
People are the heart and soul of our business. We continually strive to provide a safe, supportive, and engaging environment for our team to achieve their full potential. 

 

* **Community**
We are proud to be part of the communities we operate in globally. We are committed to supporting local causes and always operating in an environmentally responsible manner at all times.

 

* **Innovation**
Creative thinking inspires innovation in everything we do. We seek and value ideas from our team that improve our products and provide meaningful benefits to our consumers and customers.

 

 

**LEADERSHIP BEHAVIOURS**

**Drives for Results**

* Communicates Clear Vision Consistently
* Holds Self and Others Accountable
* Doesn’t Give Up
* Owns Successes and Failures
* Inspires us in Tough Times
**Exemplifies Authenticity** 

* Willing to be Vulnerable.
* Genuinely Cares for People on Their Team
* Words and Actions Match
* Makes Employees Feel Open and Comfortable
* Has a Consistent Approach to Decision Making
**Develops and Empower Others**

* Provides Timely Open and Honest Feedback
* Empowers Individuals and Teams
* Makes Everyone Feel Valued for the Work They do.
* Sets SMART Stretch Goals
* Gives People an Individual Growth Plan
**Fosters Collaboration**

* Develops Ideas With Input From Others
* Maintains an Open Mind and Listens
* Is Inclusive
* Drives Teamwork Between Functions
* Creates a Learning Environment
**Acts with Courage**

* Challenges the Status Quo
* Makes Tough Decisions
* Is Not Afraid to Have Difficult Conversations
* Actively Leads the Team Through Challenges
 

**OVERVIEW OF ROLE OR HOW THE ROLE MAKES AN IMPACT**

We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated Manufacturing Data Analyst to join our team. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in data analysis, proficiency in PowerBI, expertise in data modelling, and hands-on experience with Microsoft Dynamics 365 Finance and Operations (F&O), D365. In this role, you will play a crucial part in supporting our manufacturing company by providing insightful data analysis, generating actionable reports, and leveraging your expertise in Microsoft technologies.

**JOB RESPONSIBILITIES** 

**Data Analysis and Reporting:**

* Utilize PowerBI to analyze large datasets, extract meaningful insights, and create visually compelling reports and dashboards.
* Collaborate with stakeholders to understand business requirements and translate them into effective data visualizations.
**Data Modelling:**

* Design and implement data models that align with business needs and ensure accuracy, consistency, and efficiency in data analysis.
* Optimize existing data models for better performance and scalability.
**Microsoft Dynamics 365 F&O Integration:**

* Leverage your expertise in Microsoft Dynamics 365 F&O to extract, transform, and load (ETL) data for analysis.
* Collaborate with the IT team and business teams to ensure seamless integration between data sources and Microsoft Dynamics 365 F&O.
**Data Quality Assurance:**

* Implement data quality checks to ensure the accuracy and reliability of manufacturing data.
* Identify and resolve data discrepancies, ensuring data integrity throughout the analysis process.
**Collaboration and Communication:**

* Work with global business partners and IT teammates to capture business requirements and deliver solutions.
* Work closely with cross-functional teams, including manufacturing, finance, and IT, to understand their data needs and provide analytical support.
* Communicate findings and insights to non-technical stakeholders in a clear and understandable manner.
**SKILLS & EXPERIENCE**

**Qualifications:**

**Experience:**

* Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field (e.g., Data Science, Computer Science, Business Analytics).
* Proven experience as a Data Analyst, preferably in a manufacturing environment.
* Strong proficiency in PowerBI for data visualization and reporting.
* Expertise in data modelling and database design.
* Hands-on experience with Microsoft Dynamics 365 Finance and Operations.
* Proficient in SQL and other data query languages.
* Experience working with global teams and business units is preferred.
**Personal Attributes & Competencies:**

* Experience with additional BI tools and technologies.
* Knowledge of manufacturing processes and industry-specific challenges.
* Strong functional and technical knowledge of D365
* Proven skill as a presenter or group facilitator - comfortable communicating with employees at all levels within the organization.
* Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
* Experience gathering business, technical, and functional requirements.
* Able to manage competing priorities in a demanding environment.
**CAPABILITIES:**

* Creative Technical Solution Development and Implementation
* Drive for Accountability & Results
* Change Agility & Resilience
* Innovation Mindset
* Collaboration for Global Growth
* Consumer & Customer Centricity
* Business & Commercial Acumen
**Desirable Skills and knowledge:**

* Microsoft Dynamics 365
* Microsoft Power BI.
* Microsoft DevOps.
* MS SQL, MySQL, Azure SQL
* Structured Query Language (SQL) relevant versions (Microsoft SQL compatible)
* JSON, XML, and other Structured and Unstructured Data Modelling technologies
* Data base management (schema creation, relationship modelling, archiving strategies)
* Experience creating or using Application Program Interfaces, APIs
* Agile/Scrum experience.
* Experience utilizing ITIL processes and IT Controls and governance.

title: Administrative Assistant / Data Analyst Supporting the DEA at LAX
HR Analyst
description:
The Human Resource Analyst will work as part of the Human Resources function by collecting, compiling, reporting, and analyzing HR data, metrics, and statistics. They will apply this data to make recommendations related to company budgets, forecasting, compensation, and employee pay. This position requires an elevated understanding of the human resources and finance processes, excellent analytical and excel skills, and the ability to collaborate with cross-functional teams.

**Salary: $95k-$100,000K**

**ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:**

* Manages the “people costs” analysis monthly and quarterly, including headcount analysis, budget forecasting, and historical review.
* Tracks personnel changes and the financial impact between base and fringe.
* Change ‘bridge” to explanation of change and comment that it is actuals, budgets & forecasts verses prior statuses.
* Creates the “bridge” analysis for people costs – monthly, quarterly, annually.
* Manages all Human Resources data analytics and reporting for the company and as well as requests from parent company reporting.
* Partners with finance leadership on people cost review, as needed.
* Analyzes data and statistics for trends and patterns with attention to turnover, employee pay, in compliance with employment laws and regulations.
* Conducts compensation benchmark assessments and gives recommendations.
* Periodic review of compensation plans, and evaluate and determine appropriate market value for new and existing jobs
* May guide and/or assist with performance, benefit, CSR data and compensation review/evaluation processes.
* Support management of data in ADP and reporting to facilitate better, tuned-in analysis.
* Identifies and recommends reasonable short and long-term goals, milestones, and benchmarks for key HR metrics.
* Ensures compliance with data privacy regulations and best practices.
* Analysis of other HR ad hoc requests from parent company, Lifestyle Design and Haworth.
* Performs other duties as assigned.

  


**SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES: NONE**

  


**QUALIFICATIONS:** 

* Proficient/highly skilled with Microsoft Excel, including pivot tables and vlookup’s.
* Proficient/experience with or the ability to quickly learn the organization’s HRIS/Payroll (ADP Workforce Now).
* Excellent written communication skills.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
* Understanding of local, state, and federal employment and data privacy laws.

***Education and Experience:***

* AA or BA in Business Administration, Finance, or Human Resources
* 2-3 years’ experience in Finance, Analytics, Compensation Analysis, or similar role.

**REFLECTS OUR BRAND VALUES:**

* We listen to our Customers
* We rely on our Members
* We honor Integrity
* We embrace Continuous Learning
* We lead with Design
* We create Value
* We make the World Better

title: Data Analyst
description:
Overview

Jubilee is in search of a Data Analyst who is excited to leverage their strategic skills to accelerate the growth of Jubilee Media’s various distribution channels!

The Company  
  
At Jubilee, we're on a mission to provoke a new culture of empathy. We explore experiences that push people to feel more, think more, and see more in others. We challenge the belief of a black-and-white world, and instead embrace the complexity and richness of our experiences. By magnifying these stories we can discover personal identities, shared truths, and how we fit in the overarching human story. People are at the core of our mission and we're looking for our next family member to join the adventure. We believe that together we can change the world.  
  
The Job  
  
Our Data Analyst will play a critical role in the success of Jubilee Media’s content performance across multiple platforms. Our Data Analyst will be an expert in analyzing and reporting on data to support our creative team in making informed creative decisions to increase our content viewership and performance. This role is both operational and strategic; the Data Analyst will oversee key metrics for Jubilee Media’s O&O channels on facebook, snapchat, and TikTok, as well as share insights across the organization. This role will report directly to Jubilee’s COO and will get first-hand experience in a career trajectory that touches the intersection of all things media, growth and the ever-changing creator economy!

What You’ll Do

* Own and oversee Jubilee’s content analytics for Facebook, Snapchat, and TikTok
* Leverage data to support our creative team’s content strategy and programming
* ​​Analyze data based on ad-hoc requests from business leaders
* Collaborate closely with the Channel Management teams for Facebook, Snapchat & TikTok
* Work directly with our data tools to develop meaningful insights
* Work cross functionally with Jubilee’s Creative teams to share content insights in support of programming and format strategy
* Liaise with our data & engineering teams to develop new insights dashboards and ensure data quality

Who You Are

* 3+ years of experience in digital media, growth, or data analytics
* You have an analytical and growth focused mindset
* You are obsessed with the digital media landscape and spend your free time digging into the latest trends and newest platforms
* A data nerd who can translate numbers into insights and tell a story. Experience with platform data tools is required. Experience building in Tableau is a plus!
* You have experience successfully working cross-functionally with internal teams and external parties to drive results
* Project management, operational organization, and cross-department collaboration excites you
* You are a natural problem solver with a strong sense of urgency
* Lifelong learner
* High-level communicator
* An agile and flexible team collaborator

What We Offer

* Flexible PTO plan - take the time you need!
* Medical, Dental, Vision plans - we pay 90% of the base plan for all our full time employees
* Life Insurance, 401(k) plan
* Learning & Development Stipend
* Kitchen with free snacks & drinks
* A creative environment without rigid structure - we truly encourage our team to bring their authentic, true selves to work everyday
* Fun employee-led events, company off-sites, uniquely led team meetings, and so much more  
  
\*\*PLEASE NOTE: Jubilee has a hybrid work culture and we are currently working in-office 3 days at work with 2 days a week of remote work. As such, all candidates must be on-site in El Segundo 3 days a week and thus based near the office or willing to relocate.\*\*
